content:
うわめ〔上目〕
〈名〉An upward look; upturned eyes

content.content: 上目になる
to look up―cast up one's eyes

うわやく〔上役〕
〈名〉A senior official:(集合的に言えば)one's seniors

うわゆき〔上行き〕
〈名〉An up-stroke (of the pen)

content:
うん
〈応答詞〉Yes

content.content: うんと言え
Say yes!
うんと言う
to consent―assent
女は小声でうんと言った
She murmured her consent.
うんと言わせる
to obtain one's consent
うんと言わせるのに骨が折れた
I had much ado to obtain her consent.
いったんうんと言わせりゃこっちのものだ
Once she consents, she is ours.
うんと頷く{うなずく}
to nod assent

content: 〈名〉(=呻き{うめき})a groan

content.content: うんと唸る
to groan―give a groan―utter a groan
うんと唸って倒れた
He fell with a groan.
彼はうんともすんとも言わぬ
He utters never a word.

content:
うん〔運〕
〈名〉
1. Fortune; luck

content.content: 運が好い
to be fortunate―lucky―in luck
彼はいつも運が好い
He is always fortunate―He is always favoured by fortune―Fortune ever smiles on him―He always falls on his feet.
君は助かったのは運が好い
Bless your star that you have escaped!
僕は九死に一生を得たのは実に運が好いと思っている
I congratulate myself on my narrow escape.
運好く
fortunately―by good fortune―luckily―by good luck―as luck would have it
運好く彼は在宅であった
By good fortune, I found him at home―I was so fortunate as to find him at home―I had the good fortune to find him at home.
運好く始めから成功した
By good luck, I succeeded in my first attempt―I was so lucky as to succeed in my first attempt―I had the good luck to succeed in my first attempt.
運が悪い
to be unfortunate―unlucky―out of luck―ill-starred
彼は運が悪くて弱っている
He is down on his luck.
いつも運が悪い
He is pursued by misfortune―Fortune ever frowns on him.
運悪く
unfortunately―unluckily―by ill luck―as ill luck would have it
彼は運悪く幼い時両親に死に別れた
He was so unfortunate to―had the misfortune to―lose both his parents in his infancy.
君は運が強い
You are Fortune's favourite―a child of fortune.
運はめぐりもの、運がめぐって来る
The wheel of Fortune turns round.
運のめぐり合わせ
Fortune's wheel.
彼は運のめぐり合わせが好い、運のめぐり合わせが悪い
He is at the top of Fortune's wheel―at the bottom of Fortune's wheel.
運と月日は末を待て
Fortune's wheel turns round.
運は天に在り
Trust in Providence.
運は勇者を佑く
Fortune favours the brave.
勝敗は時の運
“It is not in mortals to command success.”
運は慾望に副うものでない
Fortune is never equal to one's desires.
持って生まれた運
one's lot in life
持って生まれた運と諦めろ
You must be content with your lot.
運の尽き
one's doom―one's ruin
彼が仲間と別れたのが運の尽きだった
His separation from his partner was his doom―his ruin.

content:
2. 
〈動詞付〉

content.content: 運が向く
Luck turns in one's favour.
彼は運が向いて来たと見える
Luck seems to be turning in his favour.
今日は強盛に運が向いて来た(とばくち打ちが言う)
I am in luck today―I have come to luck today.
今度運が向いて来たら金持ちになる
I shall grow rich at next turn of Fortune's wheel.
運が向かぬ
Luck goes against me.
今日は運が向かぬ(ばくち打ちのいわゆる“目が出ない”)
I am out of luck today.
運が開ける
Fortune begins to smile on one―One's fortune improves―One's fortune rises―Good times come.
そのうちに運が開けるだろう
It will not be long before Fortune smiles on me.
運が開けぬ
Fortune frowns on one.
彼の運は冲天の勢
His star is in the ascendant.
運が衰える
One's fortune declines.
彼の運は衰えかけている
His star is on the wane.
運を試す
to try one's fortune―try one's luck
彼は運が尽きた
He is doomed―His doom is sealed―His fate is sealed―His star has set.
運の尽きた人
a doomed man―a devoted head
運の尽きた国
a devoted land
運に任せる
to trust to luck
一つ運に任してやってみよう
I will take the risks―risk it.
運を天に任したり
The die is cast.
運を天に任して断行する
to cross the Rubicon―pass the Rubicon
人は自分の運を開拓するのだ
Each man is the architect of his own fortune.

うんい〔云為〕
〈名〉Speech and action; word and deed

〈名〉
1. (=雲と霞)cloud and haze

content.content: 雲霞と消える

content: 2. (=大群)a cloud (of witnesses)

a cloud of men and horses
敵は雲霞の如く押し寄せた
The enemy bore down upon us in stupendous force.

content: 3. (=浮塵子)the rice-fly

content.content: 雲霞発生す
The rice-fly pest has broken out.

to make canal through―canalize―a country
運河通過料
canal due―canal toll―canalage
スエズ運河
the Suez Canal
パナマ運河
the Panama Canal

content:
うんがい〔雲外〕
〈副〉Above the clouds

content.content: 山岳雲外に聳ゆ
The mountain rises above the clouds.

うんき〔運気〕
〈名〉One's fortune

content.content: 運気を卜す
to tell one's fortune―cast a horoscope―cast a nativity
運気は冲天の勢
One's star is in the ascendant.
運気は衰えかけている
One's star is on the wane.

content:
うんげい〔雲霓〕

content.content: 大旱の雲霓を望むが如し
“as the hart panteth after the water-brooks.”

content.content: 天体の運行
the revolution of the heavenly bodies

The sight of the examination papers to look over gives me a headache.

content.content: 試験の答案を見るとウンザリしてしまう
The sight of the examination papers to look over gives me a headache.

content: 〈名〉(=朝廷)the Imperial court

a court-noble

〈名〉One's fortune

content.content: 運勢が好い、運勢が悪い
One is fortunate―unfortunate.

to tell one's fortune―cast a horoscope―cast a nativity

content.content: 運星沖天の勢

content:

〈名〉Transport; transportation; transit; conveyance; carriage; forwarding:(=する) to transport; to convey; to carry; to forward

content.content: 船で運送する
to transport goods by sea
鉄道で運送する
to rail goods
運送中に悪くなる品
The goods lose quality in the transit.
陸上運送
transportation by land―conveyance by land―carriage by land
海上運送
transportation by sea―conveyance by sea―carriage by sea
水路運送
transportation by water―conveyance by water―carriage by water
運送機関
a means of conveyance―a conveyance
運送船
a transport―a freighter―a cargo-boat
運送会社
a transportation company―a forwarding company―an express company
運送店
a forwarding house
運送屋
a forwarding agent
運送業
transportation business―forwarding business―carrying trade
運送料
freight―carriage―rate―forwarding charges
運送保険
transportation insurance―transit insurance
運送貨物
freight―cargo

うんそうせん〔運送船〕
〈名〉A transport; a freighter; a cargo-boat

content.content: 運試しをしてみよう
I will try my luck―try my fortune.

content.content: 彼はその研究に蘊蓄を傾けた
He concentrated his extensive knowledge on the study of the subject.

うんちん〔運賃〕
〈名〉Carriage; portage; freight; freightage; rate; charge

content.content: 運賃は距離によって違う
The carriage varies with the distance.
船積み運賃
freight―freightage―freight rate―freight by ship―shipping expenses
鉄道運賃
railway rate―railway charge
通運の運賃
express charge
車力の運賃、荷馬車の運賃
cartage
往復運賃
freight out and home
運賃払い済み
carriage paid―freight prepaid―freight paid in advance
運賃先払い
carriage forward―freight to be paid on delivery
運賃無料
carriage-free

content:
うんでい〔雲泥〕
〈名〉Cloud and mud

content.content: 雲泥の差がある
They are as different as cloud and mud―“as like as chalk and cheese.”

content:
うんてん〔運転〕
〈名〉Motion; operation; service; traffic:(=する) to put (the machinery) in motion; to set (the machinery) going; to work (a machine or a ship); to operate (a machine); to drive (a locomotive, an electric car, a motor-car); to run (a train); to employ (capital):(自動詞に用いれば)to be in motion; to run; to go

content.content: 機械を運転する
to work a machine―(米国にては)―operate a machine―(運転を始めるの意味なら)―put the machinery in motion―set the machinery going
機関を運転する
to drive an engine―(運転を始めるの意味なら)―start the engine
機械が運転している
The machinery is in motion.
機械は昼夜運転している
The machinery is running night and day.
機械の運転を止める
to stop the machinery
この機械は蒸気で運転する
The machine is driven by steam.
水力が運転する
The machine is driven by water-power.
電気で運転する
The machine is worked by electricity―operated by electricity.
機械は運転にさし支え無し
The machine is in working order.
機関車を運転する
to drive a locomotive
列車を運転する
to run a train
列車は昼夜運転する
The trains run night and day.
列車の運転
train service
(列車の)定期運転
regular service
雪のために汽車の運転を停止した
Owing to the snow, traffic was suspended.
(列車の)運転停止
suspension of traffic
電車を運転する
to drive an electric car―run the cars
電車の運転
electric-car service
電車の運転を開始する
The cars begin to run.
大晦日は電車が終夜運転する
The car run all night on New Year's Eve.
終夜運転
all-night service
電車の運転系統
the tram system
(電車)運転台
the motor-man's platform
船を運転する
to work a ship―navigate a ship
この船を運転するに何人かかるか
How many men does it take to work this ship?
自動車を運転する
to drive a motor-car
風が吹くと風車が運転する
The wind sets the mill going.
資本を運転する
to employ capital
彼は資本を巧みに運転する
He employs his capital with skill.
運転資本
working capital

content:
うんてんし〔運転士〕
〈名〉A mate; an officer

content.content: 一等運転士、二等運転士、三等運転士
the chief ［the second, the third］ mate or officer

うんてんしゅ〔運転手〕
〈名〉(汽車のは)an engine-driver:(電車のは)a motor-man:(自動車のは)a chauffer

content:
うんと〔ウンと〕
〈副〉With all one's might; with might and main; soundly

content.content: ウンと押せ
Push with all your might!
ウンと引っ張れ
Pull with all your might!
ウンと働け
You must work with might and main.
ウンと殴ってやった
I gave him a sound thrashing.
ウンと蹴ってやった
I gave him a good kick.
ウンと叱ってやった
I gave him a good scolding―gave him a severe rating.
ウンと叱られた
I got a good scolding―got a severe rating.
ウンと食った、ウンと飲んだ
I ate my fill―drank my fill.
彼はウンと金が有る
He has lots of money―heaps of money.
そりゃウンとはずれた、ウンと違う
You are wide of the mark.
今度の家の方がウンと立派だ
The new house is much the finer of the two.
金をウンと取られた
I had to pay an exorbitant price―pay through the nose.
ウンと取ってやれ
Take as much as you can!―Take all you. can!
たまにはウンと暴れないと腹の虫が承知しない
I must have my fling once in a while.

content.content: ウンと押せ
Push with all your might!

You must work with might and main.

そりゃウンとはずれた、ウンと違う

I had to pay an exorbitant price―pay through the nose.

Take as much as you can!―Take all you. can!
たまにはウンと暴れないと腹の虫が承知しない
I must have my fling once in a while.

content:
うんどう〔運動〕
〈名〉
1. (=動くこと)motion; movement:(=する) to move

content.content: 直線運動
rectilinear motion
抛物線運動
parabolic motion
加速運動
accelerated motion
永続運動
perpetual motion
運動神経
a motor nerve
運動量
momentum

content: 2. (=軍隊や艦隊の運動)a manoeuvre; an evolution

content.content: 艦隊運動
fleet manoeuvres

content: 3. (=身体の運動)exercise:(=する) to take exercise

content.content: 君は運動をするか
Do you take exercise?
適度の運動をする
I take moderate exercise.
毎日屋外で運動する
I take exercise out of doors every day.
僕は運動としては運動をしない
I do not take exercise for its own sake.
運動は身体の薬だ
Exercise is good for the health.
運動すると飯が食える
Exercise gives one a good appetite.
一日二時間の運動は身体に必要だ
Two hours a day's exercise is necessary to health.
馬は好い運動だ
Riding is a good exercise.

content: 4. (=散歩)a walk; an airing:(=する) to take a walk; to take an airing; to take the air

content.content: 運動に行く
to go for a walk―go out for an airing
彼は馬で運動に出ました
He has gone for a ride.
彼は毎日馬車で運動に出る
He goes out for a drive every day.
五マイルも歩けば好い運動になる
Five miles is a good walk.

content: 5. (=遊戯、競戯)athletics; athletic sports; games and sports

content.content: 屋内運動
indoor games
屋外運動
outdoor sports―field sports
庭球は婦人には好い運動だ
Lawn-tennis is a good sport for ladies.
あの人は運動好きだ、運動に熱心だ
He is fond of outdoor sports―He is keen on field sports―He is a sportsman―a keen sportsman.

content: 6. (=奔走)a movement; an agitation; a campaign; a canvass; interest:(=する) to move (in the matter); to stir (in the matter); to agitate (for reform); to canvass (for votes); to run (for the presidency); to make interest (with some one); to work (some one to do something)

content.content: 内々運動している者がある
Some people are moving in the matter―stirring in the matter―in private.
彼は大臣に運動して今の地位を得たのだ
He secured his position by making interest with the Minister.
当節は運動の世の中だ
Everything goes by interest nowadays.
その筋へ運動する
to put the proper machinery in motion
彼は校長に運動して洋行さして貰ったのだ
He worked the principal to send him abroad.
政治運動
a political movement―a political agitation
政治運動を起こす、政治運動を開始する
to start a political movement―set a political agitation on foot
選挙運動
electioneering―(一回なら)―an electioneering campaign―a canvass
選挙運動をする
to electioneer―canvass for an election―canvass for votes
誰の為に運動する
to canvass for some one
誰の反対運動をする
to canvass against some one
大統領の選挙運動をする
to run for the presidency
(支那の)排日運動
an anti-Japanese movement
支那では排日運動をしている
They are making an anti-Japanese movement in China.
日貨排斥運動
the boycott of Japanese goods
日貨排斥運動をしている
They are boycotting Japanese goods.
(職工の)賃銀値上げ運動
an agitation for a rise
職工が賃銀値上げ運動をしている
The operatives are agitating for a rise.
改革運動
an agitation for reform
生徒が改革運動をしている
The students are agitating for a reform.
学校昇格運動
an agitation for the promotion of the school status
営業税廃止運動
an agitation for the abolition of the business-tax
在野党は内閣打開の運動をしている
The Opposition is agitating to overthrow the Ministry.
私娼撲滅運動
a purification campaign―a purification crusade

ウンともスンとも言わぬ
うんともすんともいわぬ

content:
うんともすんともいわぬ〔ウンともスンとも言わぬ〕
〈自動〉To say never a word

content.content: 新聞はこのことについてはウンともスンとも言わぬ
The papers preserve a perfect silence on the subject.

content:
うんどんこん〔運鈍根〕

content.content: 人は運鈍根の三つ揃わなけりゃ大成はできぬ
Luck, stolidity, and perseverance are the three factors essential to success.

content:
うんぬん〔云々〕
〈副〉
1. (=しかじか)so and so:(=の) such and such

content.content: 云々の次第であると述べた
I stated that such and such was the case.
云々の場合には云々にせよと言い付けた

content: 2. (=など)and so forth; and so on; and the like

content.content: 教授法云々の話があった

content: 3. (=する)(=話す)to talk (of something)

content:
うんぱん〔運搬〕
〈名〉Transport; transportation; transit; conveyance; carriage; portage:(=する) to transport; to convey; to carry

content:
うんめい〔運命〕
〈名〉Fate; destiny; doom; necessity; kismet

content.content: 君は運命を信ずるか
Do you believe in fate?
運命と諦める
You must resign yourself to your fate―bow to fate―submit to necessity―abide by the inevitable.
運命と諦めた
I am resigned to my fate.
運命を決する
to decide one's fate
この一戦は国家の運命を決せんとす
This battle is to decide the fate of our country.
探検隊の運命は不明なり
The fate of the expedition is unknown.
運命定まる(運が尽きる)
One's fate is sealed―One's doom is sealed.
二百三高地我が手に落ちて旅順の運命定まる
When the 203-Metre Heights fell into our hands, the fate of Port Arthur was sealed.
運命を共にする
to share one's fate
君と運命を共にする
I will share your fate―cast in my lot with you.
船長は船と運命を共にする覚悟であった
The captain was determined to share the fate of his ship―go down with his ship.
運命朝夕に迫る
One's days are numbered.
(二百三高地我が手に落ちて)旅順の運命旦夕に迫った
The days of Port Arthur were numbered.
運命と戦う
to strive against fate
運命には勝てぬ
There is no striving against fate.
人は己が運命を開拓する
Each man is the architect of his own fortune.
事業は失敗すべき運命であった
The enterprise was destined to failure―doomed to failure.
戦場で弾に当たるも当たらぬも皆運命だ
“Every bullet has its billet.”
運命の三女神
the Three Fates (Clotho, Lachesis, and Atropos)

運命論者

〈名〉Influence:(=する) to influence; to have influence on (something); to affect; to have effect on (something); to tell on (anything)

content.content: 地震は天気に影響するものか
Have earthquakes any influence on the weather?
天候は米の相場に影響する
The weather affects the price of rice.
彼の去ることは学校の盛衰に影響せぬか
Won't his absence affect the prosperity of the school?
欧州大戦は日本の経済界にだいぶ影響した
The European War greatly affected―had great effect on―the economic world of Japan.
影響を蒙る
to be influenced―be affected―by something
英語研究はだいぶ欧州大戦の影響を蒙っている
The study of English in Japan has been greatly influenced by the European war.
商業は戦争の影響を蒙っている
Commerce is affected by the war.
影響を及ぼす
to exert an influence on something
戦争が商業に影響を及ぼしている
The war has exerted its influence on commerce.
活動写真は風教に悪影響を及ぼしはせぬか

物価騰貴は戦争の影響だ
The rise in prices is due to the war―consequent on the war.
戦争の影響で物価が騰貴した
The prices have risen owing to the war―in consequence of the war.
人格というものは種々の影響を受けてできるものだ
Character is formed under various influences―influenced by various circumstances.
年は記憶力に影響する
Age tells on the memory.
戦争は影響するところ大なり
A war is attended with far-reaching consequences.

content:

〈名〉English; the English language

content.content: 英語を話す
to speak English
貴方は英語が行けますか
Do you speak English?
英語は少し行けます
I speak a little English.
あの人は英語がうまい
He speaks English well―He is a good English speaker.
下手な英語を使う

あの人はおかしな英語を話す
He speaks English very much after a fashion.
下手な英語で説明した
He explained in broken English.
英語で話す
to speak in English
英語で言う
to say it in English
それを英語で何と言うか
How do you put it in English?
この花を英語で何と言うか
What do you call this flower in English?
「流石」という事を英語でどう言うか
What is the English for “sasuga”?
彼は英語ができる
He knows English―He is an English scholar.
彼は英語がちっとはできるか
Is he anything of an English scholar?
英語がちっとはできる
He is something of an English scholar―a bit of an English scholar.
英語がなかなかできる
He is very much of an English scholar―a great deal of an English scholar.
英語はたいしてできない
He is not much of an English scholar.
英語は少しもできない
He does not know a word of English―He can not speak a word of English.
彼はひと通りの英語を心得ている
He knows plain English.
英語を学ぶ
to learn English
英語を学ぶのに近道は無いか
Is there no royal road to English?
英語を研究する
to study English
英語の研究を始める
to begin studying English―enter upon one's English studies
英語の研究法はどうするが一番好いか
What is the best way to study English?
英語研究の奨励となる
to give an impetus to the study of English
今英語をやっている
I am learning English―studying English.
英語を五年やった
I have studied English for five years.
英語を五年やっている
I have been studying English for five years.
英語を修める
to master English
勉強さえすればひと通りの英語が三年で修められる
If one worked hard enough, one might master plain English in three years.
英語は入りやすく極め難し

英語が上達する
to improve in one's English
君は英語がめっきり上達した
You show a marked improvement in your English―You have made remarkable progress in English.
彼は英語に熟達している、英語が達者だ
He is proficient in English―at home in English.
達者に英語を話す
He speaks English with facility.
彼の英語の力には敬服している
I admire his proficiency in English.
彼は英語を自在に操る
He has a perfect command of English.
彼は英語が得意だ
He prides himself on his English.
英語は人よりも進んでいる
He is ahead of the others in English.
英語が人よりも後れている
He is behind the others in English.
彼は英語の素養があるか
Is he well grounded in English?
英語を教える
to teach English
英語を使うと教えるとは別
To speak English is one thing; to teach English is quite another thing.
英語教授法

中学課程の範囲内において英語を完全に教授すること

中学校の英語は程度が低い

an English teacher―a teacher of English
彼は英語教員の地位を望んでいる
He wants a position as teacher of English.
英語教員を志願した

英語に訳す
to translate Japanese into English
英語で演説する
to make a speech in English
英語演説

世界中に通ずる国語は英語のみ

英語は誰にでも必要だ

君は英語で意を通ずることができるか

日用の英語
everyday English
新聞体の英語
journalistic English
英国訛りの英語

米国訛りの英語
an Americanism

The scenery is beautiful beyond description.

content:

content.content: 獲物がありましたか
Have you had any game?
獲物がだいぶありました
I have had much game―made a good bag―made a good take―(魚なら)―made a good catch.
獲物はたんとありません
I have had little game―made a poor bag.
獲物は鴨十羽
I have bagged five braces of ducks.

to contend for the prize

The prize is worth contending for―It is a prize worth contending for.

content: 3. (=強盗などの獲物)booty

content.content: 獲物があると親分が子分共にこれを分配する
The chief distributes the booty among his followers.

content:
えらい〔偉い〕
〈形〉Great; grand; important; wonderful; admirable

content.content: 偉い人
a great man―a hero―(昔の軍人なら)―a doughty hero―(交際界なら)―a swell
早く大きくなって偉くおなりなさい
You must grow up to be a great man.
彼は自分ばかり偉いつもりでいる
He fancies himself an important personage―He is a self-important personage.
(人をほめて)実に偉いもんだ
Wonderful!―(男なら)―Wonderful man!―(女なら)―Admirable girl!
君は実に偉い
You are grand!―I admire you!
君は偉いよ
What a great man you are!
彼はおしゃべりにかけては偉い
He is great in the way of talking.
英語では君の方が偉い
You are my superior in English.
嬶の方が偉い
“The gray mare is the better horse.”
文法の間違い無しに英語が話せたら偉いもんだ
If you can speak English without making grammatical mistakes, it is well.
あれを見てから彼は偉いと思った
After that, my respect increased for him.
偉いことをやったな
What have you done!
偉いことになったね
That it would come to this!
表はえらい人だ
The streets are crowded with people.

content: 〈副〉Very; how!

content.content: えらい立派なもんだ
It is very fine―How fine!
えらいぜいたくな人だな
He is a very extravagant man―What an extravagant man he is!

content:
えらがる〔偉がる〕
〈自動〉To fancy oneself an important person; to be self-important; to think highly of oneself; to have a high opinion of oneself

content.content: 彼は一人で偉がっている
He fancies himself an important personage―He is a self-important personage―He thinks no small beer of himself.
彼は人に向かって偉がる
He tries to impress people with his own importance.
あの先生は生徒に向かって偉がる
He tries to impress the students with his scholarship.

えらびあてる〔選び当てる〕
〈自他動〉To make a good choice; to pitch upon (the right person or thing)

content:
えらぶ〔選ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=選択する、選抜する) to choose (this or that―a wife or a friend―a woman for one's wife―a few out of a number―from among many―between tow―one thing before another); to make a choice; to fix one's choice upon (an object); to take

content.content: 妻を選ぶ
to choose a wife
妻に選ぶ
to choose a girl for a wife
大勢の中から一人選ぶ
to choose one out of a number
女房が欲しいなら大勢の中から選べる
If you want a wife, you can choose from among many―you have a large choice.
この本の中から好きな本を五冊選べ
Choose any five books out of the number.
隊長を選ぶ
to choose the leader
彼を隊長に選んだ
We chose him for our leader.
僕に選ばしたらフランス語を選ぶ
If I were to choose, I would take French―I would take French for choice.
一生のつれあいを選ぶには念には念を押せ
You can not be too careful in choosing a partner for life.
己が才能を伸ばし得る専門を選べ
Choose a profession which will give scope to your genius.
汝を益する友を選べ
Choose such companions as will do you good.
人を知らないから選ぶに当てが無い
As I do not knew the men, I must choose at random.
猟犬は鼻の利くのを選ぶか足の早いのを選ぶ
Some dogs are chosen for scent, others for speed.
人は死ぬか生きて恥をかくか二つの一つを選ばねばならない場合がある
There are occasions when a man must choose between death and dishonour.
籠城軍は餓死するか降参するか二つの一つを選ばねばならなかった
The besieged army had to choose between starvation and surrender.
この金を取れば大罪、取らねば滅亡、この二つの一つを選ばねばならぬ
You must choose between crime and ruin.
この二つは何の選ぶところも無い
There is nothing to choose between the two.
恥をかくならむしろ死を選ぶ
I should choose death before dishonour.
君は好い人(好い物)を選んだ
You have made a good choice.
(たくさんあるから)君はどれを選ぶも勝手だ
You may take your choice.
君はつまらないものを選んだものだ
You have fixed your choice upon an unworthy object―made a bad choice.

content: 2. (=選抜する、抜擢する)to select; single out; pick out (the best); to select (a few out of many―a man for some office); to cull (some from a number)

content.content: ひと粒択りに一番好いのを選んだのだ
We have selected―singled out―picked out―the best ones.
ここにある本の中から要るだけ選べ
Select―Choose―as many books as you want out of the number.
一番偉い人を隊長に選んだ
We selected―chose―the greatest man for our leader.
文豪の著書中より文例を選ぶ
to cull examples from the best writers

content: 3. (=選挙する)to elect (the president―a person president)

content.content: 大統領を選ぶ
to elect the president
ワシントンを大統領に選んだ
They elected Washington president.
ワ氏は最初の大統領に選ばれた
Washington was the first to be elected president.
議員を選ぶ
to elect a member of the Diet―vote for an M. P
彼は議員に選ばれた
He has been returned a member.
議長を選ぶ
to elect the president
誰が議長に選ばれたか
Who was elected president?
級長を選ぶ
to elect the monitor
誰が級長に選ばれたか
Who has been elected monitor?

content: 4. (=むしろ選ぶ)to prefer (one thing to another)

content.content: 僕は富貴よりもむしろ名誉を選ぶ
I prefer honour to wealth―choose honour before wealth.
生きて恥をかくならむしろ死を選ぶ
I should prefer death to dishonour―I should choose death before dishonour―I would rather die than live in dishonour.

content: 5. (=決める)to fix upon (a date, etc.)

content.content: 吉日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
平和会議の場所としてパリが選ばれた
Paris was fixed upon as the seat of peace conference.

content:
6. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 友を選べ
Keep good company―Avoid bad company.
彼は目的をとげるに手段を選ばぬ
He will accomplish his purpose by fair means or foul―He is unscrupulous about the means of accomplishing his purpose.
かかる必死の場合に手段を選んでおられぬ
We can not afford to be scrupulous about the means―nice about the means―under such desperate circumstances.
恋事と戦争には手段を選ばず
“All's fair in love and war.”
彼は時を選ばずしゃれを言う
He is witty in season and out of season.
能書筆を選ばず
“The cunning workman does not quarrel with his tool.”
窮鳥枝を選ばず
“Beggars should not be choosers.”
選んで糠を掴む
“Go farther and fare worse.”

content.content: 地位を得る

君の腕前ならどんな地位でも得られる

人心を得る

信任を得る

人望を得る

自信を得る
to gain self-confidence
名誉を得る
to gain honour
名声を得る

彼はこの本で名声を得た
This book won him a reputation.
同情を得る
to win one's sympathy
彼は不幸に逢って世間の同情を得た
His misfortune won him public sympathy.
人の信用を得る
to gain credit with some one
勝利を得る

一等賞を得る

友を得る

人を得る
to get hold of the right man

to gain one's end
彼の言うことは要領を得て居る、要領を得ない
What he says, is to the point―nothing to the purpose.
社会に立脚地を得る

敵地に足場を得る

利益を得る

How did you come by the money?
これは不正なことをして得た金ではない
I came by the money honestly.

content: 〈以下特例〉

to find one's place―find one's proper sphere or activity
好敵手を得る
to meet one's match―find one's match
安心立命を得る
to find calm resignation―resign oneself to God's will
力を得る
to be encouraged―take heart
中庸を得る
to hit the happy medium
栄を得る
to have the honour―have the pleasure―(of doing something)
参列するの栄を得た
I had the honour of taking part in the ceremony.
ご来臨の栄を得た

to have a narrow escape
虎穴に入らずんば虎児を得ず

エレベーター

content: 2. (=えにし)relation; connection; a tie; a bond; union; marriage; love

content.content: 夫婦の縁
the marriage tie―the conjugal tie―the wedding knot―the bonds of matrimony
親子の縁
the relation between parent and child
主従の縁
the relation between master and servant
血縁
blood-relationship―ties of blood―consanguinity
彼とは縁の近い親類だ
We are nearly related―near relations.
縁の遠い親類だ
We are distantly connected―distant connections―remote kinsmen.
彼とは縁を引いている
I am (distantly) connected (by blood) with him.
縁を結ぶ
to form a connection with some one
夫婦の縁を結ぶ
to tie the nuptial knot―tie the wedding knot―contract a marriage―get married
義兄弟の縁を結ぶ
to become sworn brothers
縁を切る
to cut a connection―sever connections―with some one
夫婦の縁を切る
to cut the marriage tie―dissolve the bonds of matrimony―break off conjugal relations―divorce a wife
親子(兄弟)の縁を切る
to disown one (as a son or a brother)
親類縁者と縁を切る
to cut loose from all ties
縁が切れる
Connections are cut―Connections are severed―(with some one).
どうぞ無い縁だと諦めて下さい
You must give it up as an impossible union.
これまでの縁と諦めてくれ
I can not keep up the connection with you any longer.
(売買の相談などの時に)どうもご縁が無いようです(相談が纏らぬ)
I am afraid we can not come to terms.
僕は金に縁が無い
Money does not stay in my hands.
縁は異なもの味なもの
“Marriage goes by destiny”―“Marriages are made in Heaven.”
妙なご縁で
“In time comes he (or she) whom God sends.”
金の切目が縁の切れ目
The end of money is the end of love―“When poverty comes in at the door, love flies out at the window.”
縁の遠い女

それは僕には縁もゆかりも無い人だ

〈名〉Delay; procrastination:(=する) to delay, procrastinate, put off (what ought to be done)

He lives at some distance from here.
遠方へ行く

友遠方より来たる
A friend comes from afar.

I went all the way to see him.

1. (=まるく充分に備わったこと)fullness; rotundity; perfection:(=な) full (face); round (form); well-rounded (figure or character); all-round (education); perfect (development, etc.)

content.content: 相好円満

あれは僕には縁もゆかりも無い人だ
I have not the remotest connection with him―He is nothing to me.

This has no connection with that―This has not the remotest connection with that―There is no connection between the two―There is not the remotest connection between the two.

content:
えんりょ〔遠慮〕
〈名〉
1. Reserve; distance; ceremony; deference; delicacy:(=する) to be reserved; to keep one's distance; to keep at a respectful distance; to stand on ceremony:(誰に遠慮する)to defer to (a superior);(遠慮して何々せぬ)to refrain from (doing something); to hesitate (to do something); to decline (to do something)

content.content: 彼は遠慮している
He is reserved―He keeps his distance―He keeps at a respectful distance.
自分の腹を痛めた子でないから遠慮している
She keeps her distance towards him, for he is not a child of her own bearing.
遠慮がちな振舞
distant behaviour
彼らは遠慮して食わない
They refrain from eating.
遠慮して食わずにいるのだ
They do not eat for ceremony's sake.
僕の家へ来たら遠慮することは無い
You need not stand on ceremony with me―You may make yourself at home.
あまり遠慮するのはかえって失礼だ
Too much ceremony is as bad as want of ceremony.
遠慮して言わずにいた
I refrained from speaking out of delicacy―out of regard for your feelings.
今まで遠慮して言わずにいました
I have refrained from speaking.
言おう言おうと思いながらつい遠慮して控えていました
I often thought of saying so, but I have refrained from doing so.
大屋が死んだので店子は三味線のお稽古を遠慮している
As the landlord is dead, the tenants refrain from samisen practice.
彼は長者に遠慮している、長者の手前遠慮している
He defers to his superiors.
先生に遠慮して黙っておった
I kept silent out of deference to my teacher.
喫煙は御遠慮被成下度候{きつえんはごえんりょくだされたくそうろう}
The passengers are requested to refrain from smoking.
僕にはもったいない地位だから相談に応ずるのを遠慮した
As the position was too good for me, I declined the offer.
遠慮無く
without reserve―without ceremony―freely
言いたいことがあるなら遠慮無く言い給え
You may speak without reserve.
欲しい物があったら遠慮無くそうおっしゃい
If you want anything, say so without reserve―don't hesitate to say so.
さあ何なりとも遠慮無く召上れ
Please help yourselves without ceremony.
この金は遠慮無くお使いなさい
You may spend the money freely―You are welcome to the money.
遠慮無く頂戴します
I will take it freely―take it as freely as it is given.
品物がお気に入らなかったら遠慮無くお返しなさい
If you do not like the article, you may freely send it back―You are free to send it back.
あの人は誰にでも遠慮が無い
He is free and easy with everybody―hail-fellow-well-met with everybody.
人の物を遠慮無く使う
He is free with others' possessions.
君は遠慮が無いね
I see you make yourself at home.
ここは山中の一軒家だから世間に何の遠慮も要らない
As this is a solitary cottage among the mountains, you are free to do anything you like without fear of the world.
遠慮無く言えば(遠慮無い話が)君の方が無理だと思う
To be frank with you, I think you are in the wrong.
彼は誰のことでも遠慮会釈も無く批評する
He criticizes everybody mercilessly―He spares nobody.
遠慮会釈の無い批評
merciless criticism―unsparing criticism

content: 3. (=する)(=遠ざかる)to stay away:(引き下がる)to retire; to withdraw

老いを養う
to provide for old age

content: 2. (=老人)an old man:(総称すれば)the aged

content.content: 老いの繰り言おゆるしあれ
Excuse an old man's garrulity!
老いをいたわる
to care for the aged
彼は老いの一徹でなかなか承知しない
He persists in his refusal with an old man's obstinacy―with the obstinacy of old age.

おいえそうどう〔お家騒動〕
〈名〉Internal troubles in a daimyo's family

content:
おいおい〔追々〕
〈副〉Gradually; by degrees; by and by; in time; in due time; in course of time; in process of time

content.content: 追々仕事に慣れる
I am gradually getting used to my work―I am getting used to my work by degrees.
労働者の貯蓄心も追々発達する
The labouring classes are gradually growing in the spirit of saving.
仕事が追々楽になります
My work will become easier by and by.
子どもを学校へ入れておけば追々役に立つようになる
If you keep a boy at school, he will be a useful man in time.
追々世の中も直って来る
Things will come round in course of time.
追々日が長くなる
The days are growing longer.

content:
おいかえす〔追い返す〕
〈他動〉To drive back, beat off, repel, repulse (the enemy); to send (one) about one's business

content.content: 敵国から使者を送って来たのを追い返してやった
The enemy sent us an envoy, whom we sent about his business.

content:
おいかける〔追い掛ける〕
〈他動〉
1. To start after (one); to start in pursuit of (the enemy)

content.content: ひらりと馬上に飛び乗って逃げる敵を追いかけた
He leaped on his horse and started in pursuit of the flying enemy.
我が巡洋艦は全速力を出して敵艦を追いかけた
The cruiser put on full speed, and dashed off in chase of the enemy.
追いかけて手紙を出す
to send off one letter after the other
人を追いかけて呼ぶ
to call after a man

content: 2. (=追う)to pursue, chase, run after (the flying enemy)

おいかぜ〔追い風〕
〈名〉A favourable wind; a fair wind

おいかわ〔負革〕
〈名〉The sling (of a rifle)

content:
おいこす〔追い越す〕
〈他動〉To outstrip; to outrun; to outdistance; to outsail (a ship); to pass (another car); to get ahead of (one's class); to leave (the others) behind

content.content: 赤が青を追い越した
The red has outrun the green―(競漕なら)―The red has got ahead of the green.
植民地が本国を追い越す勢いだ
The colony is outstripping―outdistancing―her mother-country.
甲丸が乙丸を追い越す
One ship outsails―outsteams―another.
彼は進歩が早いからたちまち全級を追い越した
He made such progress that he soon got ahead of his class―left his class behind.

content:
おいこみ〔追い込み〕
〈名〉The gallery (of a theatre)

content.content: 追い込み連
the gods

content:
おいこむ〔追い込む〕
〈他動〉To drive in

content.content: 象を囲いの中へ追い込む
to drive the elephants into the corral
病を追い込む
to make a disease strike inward

content:
おいこむ〔老い込む〕
〈自動〉To grow old

content.content: 君はまだ老い込むには早い
It is too early for you to grow old.

content:
おいさき〔老先〕
〈名〉The remainder of one's life; one's remaining days

content.content: 俺は老い先の短い命だ
I have not long to live―I am not long for this world.

content:
おいしい〔旨しい〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: うまい〔旨い〕

content:
おいしげる〔生繁る〕
〈自動〉To luxuriate; to be luxuriant; to be rank; to be thick

content.content: 熱帯地方は草木が生い繁っている
Vegetation luxuriates in the tropics.
山には木が生い繁っている
There is a luxuriant growth of trees on the mountains―The mountains are covered with luxuriant vegetation.
樹木生い繁って昼なお暗し
The sun's rays can not penetrate the luxuriant foliage of trees.
生い繁った草木
luxuriant vegetation
生い繁った林
a thick forest
生い繁った雑草
rank weeds
庭には雑草が生い繁っている
The garden is overgrown with rank weeds.

content:
おいすがる〔追い縋る〕
〈他動〉To tread (close) on one's heels; to run (one) hard; to run (one) close

content.content: 追手が追いすがって来た
My pursuer was treading on my heels―treading close on my heels.
競争の相手が追いすがって来た
My competitor was running me hard―running me close.

content:
おいせん〔追銭〕
〈名〉The expense of pursuit

content.content: 盗人に追銭
to throw good money after bad―throw the handle after the axe
僅かの貸金で訴訟を起こすのは盗人に追銭だ
To sue for a small debt is throwing good money after bad.

content:
おいそれと
〈副〉At a moment's notice; at short notice; readily; easily

content.content: 大金のことだからおいそれとはできない
I can't have such a large sum of money ready at a moment's notice.
縁談はそうおいそれとまとまるものではない
A marriage is not to be arranged at such short notice.
地位はそうおいそれとあるものでない
A position is not to be found so easily.
なかなかおいそれとはいくまい
It can't be done so easily.
彼は君が頼めばおいそれと聴いてくれよう
He will readily comply with your request.

content:
おいだす〔追い出す〕
〈他動〉To drive (one) out (of a place); to expel (one from a place); to oust (one from a place); to eject (one from office); to evict (a tenant from land); to turn (one) out (of doors―into the streets); to show (one) the door; to put (one) to the door

content.content: 命令に従わぬなら追い出すぞ
If you will not obey me, I will turn you out of doors.
宿銭を払う金が無いので追い出された
Unable to pay for his lodging, he was turned out into the streets.
ロシアは旅順から日本を追い出してその後へ入って澄ましていた
Russia ousted Japan from Port Arthur, and quietly stepped into her shoes.
侵入者を追い出した
I ordered the trespasser off the premises.
ぐずぐず言う奴は追い出してしまえ
If any one grumbles, show him the door!―put him to the door!
追出してしまえ
Out with him!
女房を追い出す
to put away one's wife
下男を追い出した
I have dismissed my servant from my service.

content:
おいたち〔生い立ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=育ち)breeding; bringing up; upbringing

content.content: 彼は生い立ちが好い
He was well brought up―brought up a gentleman.
彼女は生い立ちが好い
She was well brought up―brought up a lady.

content: 2. (=生長の経歴)one's early history; the childhood and youth (of a man)

content.content: 偉人の生い立ちはこんなものだ
Such is the youth and childhood of a great man.
彼の生い立ちはわからない
His early history is unknown.

おいたつ〔生い立つ〕
〈自動〉To grow up; to be brought up

content:
おいたてる〔追い立てる〕
〈他動〉To send (one) packing; to pack (one) off

content.content: 子どもらを追いたてて学校へやってしまった
I have packed the boys off to school.
王の崩御あるや寵臣は追いたてるようにして放逐された
As soon as the king died, the favourite was sent packing out of the kingdom.
追いたてるようですまないが今日は約束があるから失敬する
I am sorry to be rude, but I have an appointment to keep today.

content:
おいちらす〔追い散らす〕
〈他動〉To disperse, scatter, rout (the enemy); to put (the enemy) to rout; to drive (the enemy) like sheep

content.content: 賊軍はたちまち官軍に追い散らされた
The rebels were soon routed by the Imperial troops.

content:
おいつかう〔追い使う〕
〈他動〉To order (one) about; to work (one) hard; to drive (one) hard

content.content: あんな奴に追い使われるのはいやだ
I object to being ordered about by such a fellow.
彼らは一日追い使われて疲れている
They are tired with being worked hard―being driven hard―all day.

content:
おいつく〔追い付く〕
〈他動〉
1. To overtake; to come up with, catch up with, fetch up with (one); to overhaul (a ship):(だんだん追い付く)to gain upon, draw upon (one)

content.content: 途中で一人の旅人に追いついた
On the road, I overtook a traveller.
彼の追いついて来るのを待とう
We will wait for him to come up with us.
君先に行ってくれ、僕はじきに追いつくから
Go on before me―I will soon catch up with you.
敵艦がだんだん追いついて来た
The enemy was gaining upon us―drawing upon us.
追っても追いつく見込みがない
It is a losing chase.
稼ぐに追いつく貧乏なし
“Keep your shop, and your shop will keep you.”

content: 2. (=匹敵する)to equal, rival, match (a person or thing in some respect); to cope with, vie with, compare with (a person or thing in some point)

content.content: 英語では彼に追いつく者は無い
He has no equal in English―No one can compare with him in English―No one can come near him in English.
切れ味では日本刀に追いつくものは無い
Nothing can compare with the Japanese sword in cutting power―For cutting power, there is nothing like the Japanese sword.
我々の英語はとても彼には追いつかない
Our English is nothing like as good as his.
後悔しても追いつかない
Regrets will not mend matters.
今となってはもう追いつかない
It is past mending now.
月五十円ではとても追いつかない
I can not manage with fifty yen a month.

content:
おいつめる〔追い詰める〕
〈他動〉To run down, hunt down (a criminal); to run (a fox) to earth; to track (an animal) down; to track (an animal) to its lair; to bring (a stag) to bay, drive (a stag) to bay; to press (a fugitive) close

content.content: 罪人を追いつめる
to run down a criminal―hunt down a criminal
猟犬が鹿を追いつめる
The hounds bring the stag to bay―drive the stag to bay.
猟犬が鹿を追いつめて逃がさぬ
The hounds hold the stag at bay.
鹿が追いつめられて猟犬に向かう
The stag comes to bay―stands at bay.
鹿が追いつめられて猟犬を近づけぬ
The stag keeps the hounds at bay.
巡査が賊を追いつめた
The policemen hunted down the robber―pressed the robber close―drove the robber to bay.
賊が追いつめられて追手を近づけない
The robber kept his pursuers at bay.

content:
おいて〔於て〕
〈前置詞相当〉In; on; at

content.content: ここに於いて
in this place―at this spot
ここに於いて
on this―hereupon
大きさに於いてはこれに匹敵するものは無い
Nothing can compare with it in size.
我々に於いては異存は無い
There is no objection on our part―We have no objection.
某{それがし}に於いてはさようなことはござらぬ
Such is not the case with me.
文章に於いては申分は無い
As for the style, it leaves nothing to be desired.

content:
おいて〔追手〕
〈名〉A favourable wind; a fair wind

content.content: 追手に帆かける
to sail before the wind―drive before the wind
追手に帆かけて出帆した
We sailed with a favourable wind―with the wind in our favour.
彼は追手に帆を上げて走るようなものだ
He is sailing under a fair breeze.
追手の吹く間に帆かけて走れ
“Make hay while the sun shines.”

content:
おいで〔お出で〕
〈名〉(Honorific for) being, going, coming:(=なさる、=になる) to be; to go; to come

content.content: またおいでなさい
Please call again!
博覧会へおいでになりましたか
Have you been to the Exhibition?
お父様はおいでですか
Is your father at home?
あなたはおいでになりますか
Are you going?―Are you coming?
いつからここにおいでですか
How long have you been here?
いっしょにおいでなさい
Come along!
ここへおいでなさい
Come here!―Step here!
あちらへおいでなさい
Please go there!
ようこそおいで
You are welcome―I am glad to see you.
またおいでなすったね
He is at it again.

content:
おいてきぼり〔置いてきぼり〕
〈名〉Leaving behind

content.content: 置いてきぼりにする
to leave one behind
置いてきぼりにされた
I got left behind.
皆行ってしまって僕一人置いてきぼりにされた
They have gone away, leaving me to myself.

〈他動〉To leave (something) behind one

content.content: 彼女は田舎に置いてきた子どものことを思い出しては泣いてばかりいる
She does nothing but cry at the thought of her children she has left behind her in the country.

content:
おいてゆく〔置いて行く〕
〈他動〉To leave (anything) behind one; to leave (anything) for one

content.content: 彼女は米国へ行くのに子どもを置いて行った
She has gone to America, leaving her children behind her.
その方はこの手紙を置いて行かれました
He has left this note for you―left this note with me.

おいど
〈名〉The buttocks; the hips; the bottom; the posterior(s)

content:
おいとま〔お暇〕
〈名〉Leave-taking

content.content: お暇致します
I will take my leave―say good-bye.
お暇仕る
I humbly take my leave.

content:
おいとまごい〔お暇乞い〕
〈名〉Leave-taking:(名刺に書くには)P. P. C. (=pour prendre cong?)

content.content: お暇乞いに上がりました
I have come to say good-bye.
お暇乞いに行ってきました
I have been to take leave of my friends.

おいなおり〔生い直り〕
〈名〉A favourable turn of fortune

content:
おいぬく〔追い抜く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おいこす〔追い越す〕

content:
おいはぎ〔追剥〕
〈名〉A footpad:(往時英国の馬上の追剥)a highwayman; a knight of the road

content.content: あの森は追いはぎが出て物騒だ
The woods are infested with footpads.
おいはぎになる
to take to the road
おいはぎに逢う
to be waylaid by footpads―fall among thieves

content:
おいはご〔追羽子〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おいばね〔追羽子〕

content:
おいばね〔追羽子〕
〈名〉(The game of) battledore and shuttlecock

content.content: 追羽子をする
to play (at) battledore and shuttlecock

content:
おいばら〔追い腹〕
〈名〉Following one's master in death; self-immolation of a vassal on the death of his lord

content.content: 追い腹を切る
to follow one's lord in death―immolate oneself on the death of one's lord

content:
おいはらう〔追い払う〕
〈他動〉To drive away; to clear (the sea of pirates)

content.content: 国内の敵を追い払う
to clear the country of the enemy
国内の敵を追い払った
The land is cleared of the enemy.
野獣を追い払うために焚火をした
We made a blazing fire to scare away the wild beasts.
彼を追い払ってしまえ
Away with him!

content:
おいぼれ〔老ぼれ〕
〈名〉
1. (=老いぼれたこと)dotage; decrepitude; second childhood:(=る) to dote; to be in one's dotage; to be in one's second childhood; to become decrepit

content.content: 先生も老いぼれた
He is in his dotage―in his second childhood.
僕も年のせいで老いぼれた
Age begins to tell on me.
どうか老いぼれたくないものだ
The Lord keep my memory green!
老いぼれるな
Keep your bones green!

content: 2. (=老いぼれた人)a dotard

content.content: この老いぼれめ
You dotard!
あの老いぼれめ
The dotard!

content:
おいまくる〔追い捲る〕
〈他動〉To rout (the enemy); to put (the enemy) to rout

content.content: 露軍は日本軍のために追いまくられた
The Russian were utterly routed by the Japanese.

content:
おいまわす〔追い廻す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=つけまとう)to follow (one) about

content.content: 女の尻を追いまわす
to dangle after a girl―dangle about a girl

content: 2. (=追い使う)to order (one) about

content.content: あんな奴に追いまわされるのはいやだ
I object to being ordered about by such a fellow.

おいやる〔追い遣る〕
〈他動〉To drive away

おいらん〔花魁〕
〈名〉A high-class prostitute

content:
おいる〔老いる〕
〈自動〉To grow old; to age

content.content: 親父も老いた、もとの親父じゃない
My father has grown old; he is not what he used to be.
老いたりといえどもまだ汝輩には負けぬぞ
Old as I am, I am still-more than a match for you.
彼も老いたりというべし
He is not what he used to be.
老いて益々盛んなり
He is old in years, but young in body and mind―He enjoys a green old age.
老いては赤児の還る
“Old age is second childhood.”
女は老いては子に従う
A woman, when old, should obey her son.
少年易老学難成
“Life is short, and art is long.”
麒麟も老いては駑馬に劣る
“A young dog is better than an old lion.”

content:
おいわい〔お祝い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いわい〔祝い〕

おいわけ〔追分け〕
〈名〉
1. A parting of the ways; a forked road
2. (=追分節)a north-country air of wild beauty

content:
おう〔応〕
〈応答詞〉Yes

content.content: 否か応か返答はどうじゃ
I will have your answer, yes or no.

content:
おう〔王〕
〈名〉A king; a monarch:(=の) royal

content.content: 獅子は百獣の王
The lion is the king of beasts.
王を立てる
to set up a king
王を廃す
to depose a king―dethrone a king
王を廃立する
to dispose of the crown
将棋の王
a king
王を詰める
to checkmate the king
(米国の)鉄道王
a railroad king―a railroad magnate
暗黒界の王(魔王)
the Prince of Darkness

content:
おう〔翁〕
〈名〉An old man

content.content: 渋沢翁
Old Viscount Shibusawa.
八十翁
an octogenarian

content:
おう〔追う、逐う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=追いやる)to drive (away)

content.content: 牛を追う
to drive cattle―drive oxen
国外に追う
to banish a man (from the country)
己が頭の蠅を追え
“Mind your own business.”
仕事に追われる
to be driven by business―pressed by business
仕事を追うとも仕事に追われるな
“Drive thy business, let not thy business drive thee.”
中学生は日課に追われている
The middle-school students are overtasked with their daily lessons―too busy with their lessons.
日課に追われて何もできぬ
They are too busy with their lessons to do anything else.
煩悩の犬追えども去らず
The passions are hard of control.

content: 2. (=後を追う)to pursue (the enemy); to chase (a stag); to track (an animal); to follow (game); to run after (a hare); to make after (a man)

content.content: 人の後を追う
to run after a man―make after a man―pursue a man―start in pursuit of a man
この犬はどこへでも僕の後を追うて来る
The dog follows me wherever I go.
子どもがお母さんの後を追う
The child wants to go with mamma.
妻が夫の後を追うて死んだ
She followed him to the grave.
敵を追う
to pursue the enemy―start in pursuit of the enemy―give chase to the flying enemy
逃亡者を追う
to track a runaway―make tracks for a runaway
鹿を追う
to chase a stag―follow a stag―hunt deer
中原の鹿を追う
to contend for a political prize―fight for the crown―play for empire―electioneer
二兔を追う者一兔を得ず
“He who runs after two hares will catch neither.”
猟犬が鳥獣を追うている
The setter is on the scent of game―The hounds are on the track of a stag―on the trail of a fox.
女の尻を追う
to pursue a woman―dangle after a woman
泥棒が巡査に追われて逃げた
The chief ran pursued by a policeman―with a policeman at his heels.
快楽を追う
to pursue pleasure
名利を追う
to follow wealth or fame
流行を追う
to follow the fashion
着々利益を追う
to follow up the advantage
世の風潮を追う
to swim with the tide
追えば逃げ逃ぐれば追うは世の習い
“Follow love, and it will flee; flee love, and it will follow thee.”
追うても追いつく見込みが無い
It is a losing chase.
来る者は拒まず去る者は追わず
They are free to come and go.
順を逐うて調査する
to investigate in due order―in proper sequence
年代を逐うて研究する
to study in chronological order―make a chronological study
本が号を逐うて出る
A book comes out in numbers.
号を逐うて小説を連載する
A story is published serially.
漸を逐うて進む
to -improve by degrees―make gradual progress
世は日を逐うて、年を逐うて改まる
The times change day by day―year after year.

content:
おう〔追う、逐う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=追いやる)to drive (away)

content.content: 牛を追う
to drive cattle―drive oxen
国外に追う
to banish a man (from the country)
己が頭の蠅を追え
“Mind your own business.”
仕事に追われる
to be driven by business―pressed by business
仕事を追うとも仕事に追われるな
“Drive thy business, let not thy business drive thee.”
中学生は日課に追われている
The middle-school students are overtasked with their daily lessons―too busy with their lessons.
日課に追われて何もできぬ
They are too busy with their lessons to do anything else.
煩悩の犬追えども去らず
The passions are hard of control.

content: 2. (=後を追う)to pursue (the enemy); to chase (a stag); to track (an animal); to follow (game); to run after (a hare); to make after (a man)

content.content: 人の後を追う
to run after a man―make after a man―pursue a man―start in pursuit of a man
この犬はどこへでも僕の後を追うて来る
The dog follows me wherever I go.
子どもがお母さんの後を追う
The child wants to go with mamma.
妻が夫の後を追うて死んだ
She followed him to the grave.
敵を追う
to pursue the enemy―start in pursuit of the enemy―give chase to the flying enemy
逃亡者を追う
to track a runaway―make tracks for a runaway
鹿を追う
to chase a stag―follow a stag―hunt deer
中原の鹿を追う
to contend for a political prize―fight for the crown―play for empire―electioneer
二兔を追う者一兔を得ず
“He who runs after two hares will catch neither.”
猟犬が鳥獣を追うている
The setter is on the scent of game―The hounds are on the track of a stag―on the trail of a fox.
女の尻を追う
to pursue a woman―dangle after a woman
泥棒が巡査に追われて逃げた
The chief ran pursued by a policeman―with a policeman at his heels.
快楽を追う
to pursue pleasure
名利を追う
to follow wealth or fame
流行を追う
to follow the fashion
着々利益を追う
to follow up the advantage
世の風潮を追う
to swim with the tide
追えば逃げ逃ぐれば追うは世の習い
“Follow love, and it will flee; flee love, and it will follow thee.”
追うても追いつく見込みが無い
It is a losing chase.
来る者は拒まず去る者は追わず
They are free to come and go.
順を逐うて調査する
to investigate in due order―in proper sequence
年代を逐うて研究する
to study in chronological order―make a chronological study
本が号を逐うて出る
A book comes out in numbers.
号を逐うて小説を連載する
A story is published serially.
漸を逐うて進む
to -improve by degrees―make gradual progress
世は日を逐うて、年を逐うて改まる
The times change day by day―year after year.

content:
おう〔負う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=背負う)to bear; to carry, have, take (anything) on one's back

content.content: 重荷を負う
to bear a burden
その男は重い荷を負うておった
The man was bearing a heavy load―bending under a heavy load―carrying a heavy load on his back.
人の一生は重荷を負うて遠き道を行くが如し
Life is a journey with a burden.→『おぶう〔負ぶう〕』
女が子どもを負うている
The woman has a child on her back.
子どもを(下から)負う
to take a child on one's back

content: 2. (=債を負う)to owe (one a debt); to be indebted to (one)

content.content: 君に負うところがある
I owe you a debt―I am in your debt.
君に百円負うところがある
I owe you 100 yen―I am indebted to you in the sum of 100 yen.
僕が債務を負う
I will be liable for the debt―hold myself liable for the debt.

content: 3. (=恩を負う)to owe (one) a debt of gratitude; to be indebted to (one for something)

content.content: 僕は先生に負うところ多しだ
I owe him much―I am deeply in his debt―I am under a heavy debt to him.
日本は支那に負うところ多し
Japan owes much to China―Japan is under a debt to China.
本書の材料は都下の新聞紙に負うところ多し
For the materials of the present volume, the author is indebted to the town papers.

content: 4. (=任、責任、義務を負う)to be charged with, charge oneself with (a duty); to take (a trust) upon oneself; to owe (a duty); to lie under (an obligation); to bear, assume (the responsibility)

content.content: 義務を負う
to owe a duty―lie under an obligation
国家に対して義務を負うている
I owe my duty to my country.
各人国民の義務を負うている
Everybody owes the duties of citizenship to his country.
男子はことごどく兵役の義務を負うている
Every male subject is under an obligation to serve in the army―liable for military service.
任を負う
to be charged with a duty
彼は重任を負うている
He is charged with an important duty.
青年教育の任を負える人々だ
They are charged with the education of youth.
僕がこの任を負う
I will charge myself with the duty―take the trust upon myself.
責任を負う
to bear the responsibility―assume the responsibility
それは僕が責任を負う
I will answer for it―be responsible for it―hold myself responsible for it.
後はどうなろうと僕が責任を負う
I will answer for the consequences.
君に責任を負わせる
I will hold you responsible for the consequences.

content: 5. (=罪を負う)to be charged with (a crime); to be accused of (a crime); to answer for (a crime)

content.content: 彼は大罪を負うている
He is charged with a heinous crime.
冤罪を負う
to be falsely accused
僕は罪を負うて身を引く
I will answer for the crime.
罪を負うて切腹する
I will answer for my crime with my life.

content: 6. (=傷を負う)to receive, sustain (a wound)

content.content: 重傷を負う
to sustain a severe wound―be severely wounded
軽傷を負う
to receive a slight wound―be slightly wounded
微傷を負う
to get a scratch
悪名を負う
to incur infamy―be branded―be stigmatized
賊名を負う
to be branded as a rebel―stigmatized as a rebel
名にし負う
to be noted―famed―famous―renowned―celebrated

content:
おうあ〔欧亜〕
〈名〉Europe and Asia:(=の) Europeo-Asiatic

content.content: 欧亜雑種(あいのこ)
a Eurasian

content:
おうい〔王位〕
〈名〉The throne

content.content: 王位に即く
to accede to the throne―come to the throne
王位を継ぐ
to succeed to the throne
Edward は Victoria を継ぎて英国の王位に登る
Edward succeeded Victoria on the throne of England.
王位継承問題
succession to the throne
王位に登る
to ascend the throne―mount the throne
王位に坐す
to sit on the throne
王位に在り
He is on the throne.
王位を去る
to abdicate the throne
王位を譲る
to abdicate the throne in favour of one's successor
王位を争う
to pretend to the throne―fight for the throne
王位を奪う
to usurp the throne
王位より落とす
to dethrone a king

content:
おういつ〔横溢〕
〈名〉Overflowing:(=する) to overflow

content.content: 彼は同情が横溢している
He is overflowing with sympathy.
精力横溢
He is overflowing with energy.
元気横溢
He is in exuberant spirits.

おういん〔押印〕
〈名〉Sealing:(=する) to seal, affix a seal to (a paper)

おういん〔押韻〕
〈名〉Rhyme:(=する) to rhyme

content:
おうえん〔応援〕
〈名〉
1. (=援助)aid; assistance; rescue; succour; reinforcement:(=する) to aid; to assist; to rescue; to succour; to reinforce

content.content: 応援に行く
to go to one's aid―go to the rescue
応援に来る
to come to one's aid―come to the rescue
応援を求める
to call in one's aid―call in some one to one's aid
支那はロシアの応援を求めた
China called in the aid of Russia―called in Russia to her aid.
大将は歩兵一旅団を率いて城兵を応援した
The general succoured the garrison―reinforced the garrison―with a brigade of infantry.
応援軍
reinforcements

content: 2. (=声援)moral support; backing:(=する) to support; to back; to cheer

content.content: 選手の競漕には全校が応援した
Our champions were backed by the whole school.
彼は候補者応援のために方々で演説をして歩いた
He made speeches to back the candidate―in support of the candidate.
応援者
a backer―a supporter
応援団
a supporting party―a cheering party

content:
おうおう〔往々〕
〈副〉Often; frequently; commonly:(時としての意味に用いれば)sometimes

content.content: それは往々あることだ
It is of frequent occurrence―Such things will happen―Such things are apt to happen.
水が切れることが往々ある
It often happens that―It sometimes happens that―water fails.
その思い違いは往々ある
People will think so―People are apt to think so.
けがは往々ある
Accidents will happen.
謙遜家が世に認められないことは往々ある
Modest worth often goes unrewarded.
船乗り生活には危険は往々ある
A seafaring life is liable to danger―Dangers are incidental to a seafaring life.
男女間の間違いは青年には往々ある
Indiscretion is incidental to youth―Youth will be indiscreet―Young men are apt to commit indiscretions.
戦時には往々あることだがその女は夫が戦死したものと思って再縁した
As often happens in time of war, the woman gave up her husband for lost and married again.
女には往々あることだが彼女は好奇心が強い
As is often the case with women, she is curious―She is curious, as women will be.
詩人には往々あることだが彼は飄然と来たって飄然と去る
As is often the case with poets, he is here today and away tomorrow―He is here today and away tomorrow, as poets will.
学生には往々あることだが彼は有れば有るだけ使ってしまう
As is often the case with students, he will spend all he has―He will spend all he has, as students will.
こんな事件には往々あることだが事件の裏には女がいる
There is a lady in the case, as there will be.

content:
おうおう〔怏々〕
〈副〉Moodily; gloomily

content.content: 怏々として楽しまず
I am depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the dumps―in the dismals―in the doldrums―in the blues―I have a fit of the blues.

content:
おうか〔応化〕
〈名〉Adaptation; self-adjustment:(=する) to adapt oneself to (conditions); to adjust itself to (the climate)

content.content: 身体は気候に応化する
The body adjusts itself to the climate.
日本人は応化しやすい国民だ
The Japanese are an adaptable people.
応化性
adaptability

おうか〔欧化〕
〈名〉Europeanization:(=する) to Europeanize; to be Europeanized

content:
おうか〔王化〕
〈名〉Influence of benign rule; assimilation (of a new territory):(=する) to assimilate, digest (a new territory)

content.content: 新領土を王化する
to assimilate a new territory―digest a new territory
新領土は王化に潤う
The new territory prospers under the benign rule of the Emperor.

content:
おうか〔桜花〕
〈名〉Cherry-blossoms

content.content: 桜花爛漫
The cherry-blossoms are in all their glory.

content:
おうか〔謳歌〕
〈名〉Applause; eulogy:(=する) to applaud; to eulogize; to sing one's praises; to chant one's praises

content.content: 君が世を謳歌する
to sing the praises of the glorious reign
時の人は皆徳川の徳を謳歌した
The people chanted the praises of Tokugawa's virtues.
神徳を謳歌する
to glorify God
僕は決して彼の行動を謳歌せんとするものではない
I do not mean to applaud his conduct.

おうが〔横臥〕
〈名〉Lying down:(=する) to lie down

おうかくまく〔横隔膜〕
〈名〉The diaphragm; the midriff

おうかん〔往還〕
〈名〉
1. (=公道)a road; a highway; a thoroughfare
2. (=往復)going backward and forward (between two places)

おうかん〔王冠〕
〈名〉A crown; a diadem

おうがんきょう〔凹眼鏡〕
〈名〉Concave glasses

おうき〔王旗〕
〈名〉The royal standard

content:
おうき〔嘔気〕
〈名〉Nausea; vomiturition

content.content: 嘔気を催す
to feel nausea

content:
おうぎ〔奥義〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おくぎ〔奥義〕

content:
おうぎ〔扇〕
〈名〉A fan; a folding-fan

content.content: 扇を開く、扇を閉じる
to open a fan―shut a fan
扇を使う
to use a fan―fan oneself
西洋婦人は扇を艶に使う
Foreign ladies flirt the fan.
扇の使い分け
fan-tricks
扇を翳{かざ}す
to shade one's eyes with a fan
秋の扇と棄てられる
to be thrown away like an old hat
扇の要
the pivot of a fan―the rivet of a fan
扇の骨
the ribs of a fan
扇の地紙
fan-paper
扇舞い
a fan-dance
扇形
fan-shaped

おうぎゃく〔横逆〕
〈名〉Iniquity; wickedness:(=なる) wicked; iniquitous

content:
おうきゅう〔応急〕
〈形〉Temporary; emergency

content.content: 応急手当
emergency treatment―first aid
応急手当をする
to give one first aid
戦友が応急手当をしてくれた
His comrades gave him first-aid treatment.
応急手当はどうすれば好いか
What is to be done as first aid?
応急手当で助かった者が多い
Many were saved by first aid.
応急策を取る
to take emergency measures
応急修理
temporary repairs―emergency repairs
(機械などを)応急修繕する
to doctor a machine
応急工事
temporary work
応急マスト
a jury-mast
応急手箱
a medicine-chest for emergencies

おうきょう〔凹鏡〕
〈名〉A concave mirror

おうきょうびょう〔黄彊病〕
〈名〉Yellow muscardine (attacking silkworms)

おうけい〔凹型〕
〈名〉Concavity; an intaglio

おうけん〔王権〕
〈名〉
1. (=君権)sovereign rights; royal prerogatives
2. (=王位)royalty; sovereignty; the sceptre

content:
おうこ〔往古〕
〈名〉Ancient times; antiquity:(=の) ancient; of old; of yore

content.content: 往古より
from time immemorial―time out of mind
往古より将相の地位を占めた家柄だ
The family has led armies and made laws time out of mind.

content:
おうこう〔往航〕
〈名〉The outward voyage:(=する) to make an outward voyage

content.content: 船は往航中
The ship is outward bound.

content:
おうこう〔横行〕
〈名〉Stalking:(=する) to stalk (the land, etc.)

content.content: 天下を横行する
to stalk the land
逆臣天下を横行す
Turbulent subjects stalked the land.
ロシアでは白昼強盗が市街を横行した
In Russia, robbers stalked the streets in broad daylight.
満洲は馬賊が横行する
Manchuria is infested with mounted bandits.
近頃は自動車が市中を横行する
Motor-cars now dash about the city―flash about the city.

content:
おうこう〔王侯〕
〈名〉Princes; rulers of men; royalty

content.content: 王侯の家に生まれる
to be born in the purple
彼は王侯の風采がある
He has the air of a prince.
彼は王侯に必須の徳を欠いている
He lacks the virtues requisite to a ruler of men.
人に王侯たる者の持つべきものは徳なるかな
How requisite are princely virtues to rulers of men!
その豪奢王侯をしのぐ
They vie with royalty in splendour.
王侯将相何かあらん
“A cat may look at a king.”
王侯将相何ぞ種あらんや
“One man is as good as another”―(and a damned sight better―と付け加えたのが Irishman の失錯話し).

おうこうしょうしょう

content:
おうこうしょうしょう〔王侯将相〕
〈名〉Princes; rulers of men

content.content: 王侯将相何かあらん
“A cat may look at a king.”
王侯将相何ぞ種あらんや
“One man is as good as another”―(and a damned sight better―と加えたのが Irishman の失錯話).

おうこく〔王国〕
〈名〉A kingdom; a monarchy

content:
おうごん〔黄金〕
〈名〉
1. (=金)gold:(=の) gold; golden

content.content: 黄金の鍵にて明かぬ錠無し
“The golden key opens every door.”
黄金時代
the Golden Age
彼はいま黄金時代だ
He is now at the summit of his prosperity―at the zenith of his prosperity.
黄金国
an El Dorado
黄金世界
a Utopia
黄金律
the golden rule
黄金熱
gold-fever

content: 2. (=金銭)money

content.content: 米国は黄金万能だ
Money is everything―The dollar is almighty―in America.
黄金万能主義
the almighty dollar
黄金を崇拝する
to worship mammon―worship the golden calf
黄金崇拝
mammonism―plutolatry―L. S. Deism

content:
おうさつ〔鏖殺〕
〈名〉Wholesale slaughter; wholesale massacre; extermination; annihilation:(=する) to slaughter; to massacre; to exterminate; to annihilate; to cut up; to cut in pieces

content.content: 敵を鏖殺する
to slaughter the enemy―cut up the enemy
決死隊は鏖殺せられた
The forlorn hope was cut in pieces.
全軍鏖殺
the annihilation of the whole army―a holocaust

content:
おうし〔横死〕
〈名〉Death by violence; a violent death:(=する) to die by violence; to die a violent death

content.content: この家の人はことごとく横死を遂げた
Every member of the family died by violence―died a violent death.

content:
おうし〔王師〕
〈名〉The Imperial army

content.content: 王師の向かうところ敵無し
The Imperial army is invincible.

content:
おうし〔牡牛〕
〈名〉A bull

content.content: 去勢牡牛
an ox

content:
おうじ〔往事〕
〈名〉Past events; bygones

content.content: 往事は問わず
“Let bygones be bygones.”

content:
おうじ〔往時〕
〈名〉Old times; former times; bygone days:(副詞に用いれば)in old times; in former times; in bygone days; in days gone by; of old

content.content: 往時を語る
to talk over old times
往時を追懐する
to look back on the past―take a retrospect of one's life
往時を追懐すれば感慨に堪えず
A retrospect of my past life fills me with deep emotions.
往時を追慕する
to look back to the past

content:
おうじ〔王子、皇子〕
〈名〉A prince; an Imperial prince

content.content: 第三皇子
the third son of the Emperor

content:
おうじ〔王子、皇子〕
〈名〉A prince; an Imperial prince

content.content: 第三皇子
the third son of the Emperor

content:
おうじ〔王事〕
〈名〉The cause of royalty; the Imperial cause

content.content: 王事に尽す
to labour in the cause of royalty―fight for the Imperial cause

おうじく〔横軸〕
〈名〉A transverse axis

おうしつ〔王室〕
〈名〉The royal house; the royal family

content:
おうじつ〔往日〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おうじ〔往時〕

content:
おうじて〔応じて〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=準じて)in proportion to (one's means); according to (circumstances, etc.)

content.content: 分に応じて出金する
to give in proportion to one's means―give according to one's means―give one's mite
力に応じて国家に尽す
to serve one's country according to one's ability―do one's bit for one's country
必要に応じて
according to the need
必要に応じて金を増す
The money will be increased according to the need―as required.
必要に応じて金額をきめる
The amount will be decided upon according to the needs of the case―as the needs of the case may demand―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The needs of the case will determine the amount.
必要に応じて兵員を増減する
The number of troops may be increased or decreased according to the exigencies of the times―as the exigencies of the times may demand.
緩急に応じて処置すべし
Let measures be taken according to the urgency of the case―as the urgency of the case may demand.
事情に応じて処置せよ(臨機応変の処置をせよ)
Act according to circumstances.
収入に応じて費用を調節せよ
Adjust your expenses to your receipts.
国力に応じて軍備を制限する
to limit the armament to the resources of the country
文明の進歩に応じて戦争は無くなる
With the advance of civilization, man will cease from strife.

content: 2. (=答えて、従って)in answer to (summons); in reply to (a question); in response to (one's appeal); in obedience to (orders); to meet (a need)

content.content: 召喚に応じて出廷した
I appeared in court in answer to the summons―in response to the summons.
召集に応じて集まった
They gathered in response to the call.
国家の急に応じて身を捧げた
He gave his life in response to the call of duty.
質問に応じて説明した
I explained in reply to the question.
貴命に応じて上京可仕候
I shall come to town in obedience to your wishes.
これは刻下の必要に応じてできた本だ
The book was written to meet the need of the hour.
英国は刻下の必要に応じて徴兵制度を採用した
England adopted the conscription system to meet an emergency.

〈名〉A king; a monarch; a ruler; a sovereign

〈名〉
1. (=返事)a reply; an answer
2. (=返礼)a return

〈名〉Seizure; confiscation; attachment:(=する) to seize, confiscate, attach, impound, take legal possession of (one's property, etc.)

〈名〉Europe:(=の) European

content.content: その船はいま欧州へ行っている
The ship is now in European waters.
欧州大陸
the continent of Europe
欧州列国
the European States

content:
おうしゅう〔欧洲、欧州〕
〈名〉Europe:(=の) European

content.content: その船はいま欧州へ行っている
The ship is now in European waters.
欧州大陸
the continent of Europe
欧州列国
the European States

〈名〉A hollow; a depression; a concavity

おうじょ〔王女、皇女〕
〈名〉A princess; an Imperial princess

おうじょ〔王女、皇女〕
〈名〉A princess; an Imperial princess

〈名〉The king (of chess)

content:
おうしょう〔鞅掌〕
〈名〉Being busy:(=する) to be busy with (affairs)

content.content: 事務に鞅掌する
to be busy with the affairs
国事に鞅掌して席の暖まるにいとま有らず
I am so busy with the affairs of state that I have no time to sit down.

content:
おうじょう〔往生〕
〈名〉
1. (=死)death:(=する) to die

content.content: 眠るが如き大往生
a calm death―euthanasia
眠るが如き大往生を遂げた
He passed away as in sleep.
極楽往生する
to go to Paradise
ピストル往生する
to blow one's brains out
鉄道往生する
to throw oneself under a train―throw oneself before a passing train―(西洋では)―jump from a running train
これで往生するだろう
This will do the business for him―do the job for him―do for him.
往生際が悪い
to die hard

content: 2. (=屈服)submission:(=する) to submit; to yield; to give in

content.content: 無理に往生させる
to force one to submit―compel one to comply
娘を無理に往生させた
They forced her inclinations.
説きつけてやっと往生させた
I have persuaded her into submission―persuaded her into compliance.
(争っても無益だから)往生するよりほかはあるまい
There is nothing for it but to submit.
そんなことくらいで往生する奴ではない
He is not the man to give in to such mild measures.

content: 3. (=絶体絶命)the last extremity; one's wits' end

content.content: あの時は全く往生した
I was then at my wits' end.
今度の試験には往生した
The examination has floored me.
人間もああなっては往生だ
He is at his last extremity―His doom is sealed―He is a gone case―It is all over with him―It is all up with him.
年をとっては往生だ
When one has grown old, it is all up with one.

おうじょう〔王城〕
〈名〉A royal palace

content.content: 往生際が悪い
to die hard
猫は往生際が悪い
The cat is a hard-lived animal.
現内閣は往生際が悪い
The present Cabinet is tenacious of life.
往生際の悪い奴だ
Why do you cling to a miserable life?

hours for visiting patients

The shocks were both vertical and horizontal.

content:
おうずる〔応ずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=応答する)to answer (an advertisement); to reply to (the fire); to return (the fire); to respond to (an invitation); to obey (orders)

content.content: 募集に応ずる
to answer an advertisement respond to an invitation―come forward
株式の募集に応ずる
to subscribe for shares―take up shares
公債の募集に応ずる
to take up a loan
懸賞募集に応ずる
to enter a prize contest
募集に応ずる者無し
None come forward.
質問に応ずる
to answer a question
質問に応じて説明した
I explained in answer to the question.
砲台は砲火に応じた
The forts replied to our fire―returned the fire.
声に応ずる
to respond to one's call
鳥が声に応じて集まって来る
The bird come in response to your call―at your call.
命に応じて上京した
I came to town in obedience to orders.
召喚に応ずる
to obey the summons―answer the summons―respond to the summons
召喚に応じて出廷した
I appeared court in obedience to the summons.
召集に応ずる
to respond to the call
召集に応じて集まった
They gathered in response to the call.
国家の急に応ずる
to respond to the call of one's country―respond to the call of duty
迅速に国家の急に応ぜよ
Be prompt at duty's call!
挑戦に応ずる
to accept a challenge―take up the gauntlet
門を打てども叩けども応ずる者はあらばこそ
I might knock and knock at the gate, but never a man answered my knock.

content: 2. (=承諾する)to comply with (a request); to accede to (a request); to consent to (a proposal); to agree to (a proposal); to close with (an offer); to accept (an invitation); to meet (one's wishes, etc.)

content.content: 依頼に応ずる、乞いに応ずる、需めに応ずる
to comply with a request―accede to a request―oblige one
彼は快く依頼に応じてくれた
He readily complied with my request.
遺憾ながらご依頼に応じかねます
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request―I am sorry I can not oblige you.
彼の依頼に応じて仕事を引受けた
I undertook the work in compliance with his request―at his request.
揮亳の需めに応ず
Requests for writing (or painting) complied with.
肖像揮亳の需めに応ず
Portraits painted.
相談に応ずる
to consent to a proposal―agree to a proposal―close with an offer―accept an offer
彼は快く相談に応じてくれた
He readily consented to my proposal―met me half-way.
そんな相談には応じかねます
I can not agree to such a proposal.
こんなうまい相談には誰でも悦んで応ずる
Anybody would jump at such a proposal.
要求に応ずる
to comply with one's demands―meet one's demands―satisfy one's demands
先方で要求に応じなければ訴えるよりほかは無い
If the other party will not comply with my demands, I shall have to proceed against him.
支払要求には一々応じかねる
We can not meet all demands―meet all claims.
望みに応ずる
to comply with one's wishes―meet one's wishes
彼は父の望みに応じて医者になった
He became a physician in compliance with his father's wishes.
お望みに応ずることができようと思う
I hope I shall be able to meet your wishes.
招待に応ずる
to accept an invitation
註文に応ずる
to take up an order
彼はある婦人に結婚を申込んだが先で応じなかった
He proposed to a lady, who refused him.

content: 3. (=適う)to meet (a need); to satisfy (the demand); to fulfil (one's expectations); to answer (one's hopes); to supply (a want)

content.content: 必要に応ずる
to meet a need
刻下の必要に応ずる
to meet an emergency―meet the exigencies of the hour
英国は刻下の必要に応じて徴兵制度を採用した
England adopted the conscription system to meet an emergency.
必要に応じて
according to the need
必要に応じて金額をきめる
The amount will be decided upon according to the needs of the case―as the needs of the case may demand―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The needs of the case will determine the amount.
時世の必要に応じて児童を教育すべし
Children must be educated according to the needs of the times.
これは痛切なる必要に応じて出来た本だ
The book was written to meet a pressing need―to supply a keenly felt want.
時世の必要に応じて兵を増減する
The number of troops may be increased or decreased according to the exigencies of the times―as the exigencies of the times may demand.
時代の要求に応ずる
to meet the needs of the times―meet the exigencies of the times
時代の要求に応じた策だ
The scheme meets the exigencies of the times.
この教科書は時代の要求に応じている
The text-book is up to the needs of the times―The book supplies a felt want―supplies a desideratum.
急に応ずる
to meet an emergency
急に応ずる備えがあるか
Are there provisions to meet emergencies?
緩急に応ずる
to act according to the urgency of the case
緩急に応じて処置すべし
Let measures be taken according to the urgency of the case―as the urgency of the case may demand.
需要に応ずる
to meet the demand―supply the demand
供給は需要に応じかねる
The supply can not meet the demand―The supply is inadequate to the demand.
結果は予期に応じない
The result does not meet my expectations―fulfil my expectations―answer my expectations―come up to my expectations.
機に臨み変に応ずる
to act according to circumstances―accommodate oneself to circumstances

content: 4. (=準ずる)to be proportional, proportionate, in proportion (to one's means, etc.)

content.content: 分に応じて出金する
to give in promotion to one's means―give according to one's means―give one's mite
各自分に応じて国家に尽すべし
Let each serve his country according to his means―do his bit for his country.
国力に応じて軍備を制限する
to limit the armament to the resources of the country
収入に応じて費用を調節せよ
Adjust your expenses to your income.
知識の進歩に応じて嗜好が高尚になる
One's tastes become more refined with the progress of knowledge.
文明の進歩に応じて戦争は無くなる
With the advance in civilization, man will cease from strife.

1. A round trip; going backward and forward (between two places); going to and from (a place); going up and down (a river); plying along (a river); running between, plying between (two places):(=する) to make a round trip; to go backward and forward, go back and forth (between two places); to go to and from (a place); to go up and down (a river); to ply along (a river); to run between, ply between (two places)

content.content: 僕は毎日学校へ二度往復する
I make two trips to the school every day.
京浜間は電車が頻繁に往復する
Electric cars constantly run backward and forward between Tokyo and Yokohama―The cars are constantly running between Tokyo and Yokohama.
あの人は始終京浜間を往復している
He is constantly going backward and forward between Tokyo and Yokohama.
神戸へ往復

Protestations against the arbitrary measures of the Governor were heard on every side.

おうぼしゃ〔応募者〕
〈名〉A respondent (to an advertisement); an applicant (for entrance); a subscriber (for shares)

おうま〔牡馬〕
〈名〉A horse; a stallion

content:
おうみょう〔奥妙〕
〈形〉Profound; mysterious; abstruse; recondite

content.content: 奥妙な真理
a profound truth
奥妙な教義
an abstruse doctrine―a recondite doctrine
奥妙な原理
mysterious principles

content:
おうむ〔鸚鵡〕
〈名〉The parrot

content.content: 鸚鵡は人の真似をする
A parrot will imitate human speech.

おうむがい〔鸚鵡貝〕
〈名〉The nautilus

おうむがえし〔鸚鵡返し〕
〈名〉A repetition of another's words:(=する) to repeat another's words

content:
おうめん〔凹面〕
〈名〉A concave surface:(=の) concave

content.content: 凹面鏡
a concave mirror

content:
おうよう〔応用〕
〈名〉
1. (=適用)application:(=する) to apply (a rule to a case)

content.content: 規則を応用する
to apply a rule to a case
この規則は応用が広い
The rule is of wide application.
この規則はどんな場合にも応用ができる
The rule applies to every case―The rule holds true in every case.
この規則は応用のできぬことがある
The rule does not apply to all cases―The rule is not always applicable―The rule does not always hold true.
航海術は天文学を応用したものだ
Navigation is an application of astronomy.
電気には種々の応用がある
Electricity is applied to various uses.
応用科学
applied science
応用化学
applied chemistry
応用数学
applied mathematics
応用問題
a problem for application

content: 2. (=適応)adaptation:(=する) to adapt (the means to the end)

content.content: 日本人は応用の才が有る
The Japanese have a genius for adaption―The Japanese are an adaptable people.
泰西の文物を応用した
They have adapted things Western.

content:
おうよう〔大様、鷹揚〕
〈形〉Generous; liberal; magnanimous; ingenious; deliberate; dignified; haughty; pompous

content.content: 彼は金使いが大様だ
He is free with his money―generous with his money―liberal of his money.
大様に人に物をくれる
He is free with his possessions.
さすがは金持ちの坊ちゃんだけあって大様なものだ
His generosity is worthy of a rich man's son.
大様な生い立ちだ
He was ingenuously brought up―He is an ingenuous youth.
大様に構える
to assume a magnanimous air
大様な態度をとる
to assume a magnanimous attitude
大様な歩きぶりだ
He walks with a deliberate gait.
大様に挨拶する
to greet one with a dignified air―make a dignified bow
大様にあたりを見まわした
He looked around with a haughty air.

content:
おうよう〔大様、鷹揚〕
〈形〉Generous; liberal; magnanimous; ingenious; deliberate; dignified; haughty; pompous

content.content: 彼は金使いが大様だ
He is free with his money―generous with his money―liberal of his money.
大様に人に物をくれる
He is free with his possessions.
さすがは金持ちの坊ちゃんだけあって大様なものだ
His generosity is worthy of a rich man's son.
大様な生い立ちだ
He was ingenuously brought up―He is an ingenuous youth.
大様に構える
to assume a magnanimous air
大様な態度をとる
to assume a magnanimous attitude
大様な歩きぶりだ
He walks with a deliberate gait.
大様に挨拶する
to greet one with a dignified air―make a dignified bow
大様にあたりを見まわした
He looked around with a haughty air.

content:
おうらい〔往来〕
〈名〉
1. (=通行)traffic:(=する) to come and go; to pass

content.content: 往来する人
passers-by―passengers
この通りは往来が頻繁だ
This street is much frequented by passengers.
往来織るが如し
The streets are crowded with traffic.
十二時には往来が絶える
The streets are deserted at twelve.
昼夜往来が絶えぬ
Traffic is continuous night and day.
路幅が狭くて自動車は往来することができぬ
The streets are narrow and impassable for motor-cars.
往来の邪魔をしてはいかん
You must not stand in the way of passengers―obstruct traffic.
往来止
No thoroughfare.
その間に種々の考えが胸を往来した
Meanwhile various thoughts passed through my mind.
千軍万馬の間に往来する
to fight many battles
彼は千軍万馬の間に往来した古兵{ふるつわもの}だ
He is a veteran of a hundred battles.
数は四五千の間を往来している
The number ranges between four and five thousand.
米価は五十円台前後を往来している
The price of rice hovers near the 50 yen level.

content: 3. (=往還)a road; a street; a thoroughfare

content.content: 往来をふさぐ
to block the road―block the street
酔漢が往来の真中に寝ている
A drunkard is lying in the middle of the road.
あの男は往来で食事をする
He eats in the streets.
家は往来から引込んでいる
The house stands back from the road.
往来じゃ話ができない
It won't do to stand and talk here.

content: 4. (=交際)intercourse:(=する) to associate with, keep company with (a person)

content.content: 僕はあの連中とは往来しない
I do not go with that set.
両家は互いに往来している
The two families are on visiting terms.

content: 5. (=文通)correspondence:(=する) to correspond with (a person)

content.content: まだ手紙の往来がある
I still correspond with him―I still carry on correspondence with him.

content:
おうらいどめ〔往来止〕
〈名〉No thoroughfare

content.content: 片側往来止
No thoroughfare on this side.
橋の改築中往来止
The bridge is closed to traffic during reconstruction.
橋の修繕中車馬往来止
Horse and wheel-traffic is stopped―No thoroughfare for houses and vehicles―while the bridge is under repairs.

おうりゅう〔横流〕
〈名〉Overflow:(=する) to overflow (the banks)

content:
おうりょう〔横領〕
〈名〉Usurpation; seizure; dispossession; assumption:(=する) to usurp (the throne); to seize upon (one's property); to dispossess, defraud (one of one's property); to assume (a title, etc.)

content.content: 人の財産を横領する
to usurp one's property―seize upon one's property―dispossess one of one's property―defraud one of one's property
位を横領する
to assume a rank―(王位なら)―usurp the throne

content:
おえない
〈形〉→『

content.content: てにおえない〔手におえない〕

content:
おえる〔終える、卒える〕
〈他動〉To end; to finish; to complete; to accomplish (a journey); to get through with (one's task, etc.)

content.content: 学校を卒える
to finish school
中学の課程を卒える
to complete the middle-school course―finish one's middle school
大学を卒える
to graduate from a university―(は英、米は)―be graduated at a university
仕事を終える
to finish one's work―get through with one's task
仕事を終えたらすぐ行くとそう言ってくれ
Say I am coming as soon as I get through with my task.
今日の仕事は終えた
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through for today.
式を終える
to go through a ceremony
試験を終える
to go through an examination
試験を終えて帰省した
My examination over, I went home.
旅行を終える
to accomplish a journey
彼は旅行を終えて帰宅した
He has returned home from his journey.
この本を読み終えた
I have finished reading-done reading―this book.
食事を終えてから市街をぶらつきに出かけた
After dinner,―Dinner over,―I went out for a stroll about the streets.

content:

content.content: 学校を卒える

to finish one's work―get through with one's task

式を終える

to go through an examination
