I have finished reading-done reading―this book.
食事を終えてから市街をぶらつきに出かけた
After dinner,―Dinner over,―I went out for a stroll about the streets.

content:
おお〔大〕
〈接頭詞〉
1. Large (river); great (fire); gross (mistake); loud (voice); arrant (knave); egregious (ass); rank (nonsense); notorious (robber); bouncing (lie); severe (earthquake); heavy (rain)

content.content: 大河
a large river
大火事
a great fire
大当たり
a great hit
大雨
a heavy rain
大嵐
a severe storm
大風
a gale―a hurricane
大地震
a great earthquake―a severe earthquake
大間違い
a gross mistake
大悪党
an arrant knave
大ばか者
an arrant fool―an egregious ass―a holy imbecile
大泥棒
a notorious robber
大嘘
a bouncing lie
(着物に構わないどころか)大洒落者だ
He is a positive dandy.
大西郷
Saigo senior
(君はあの人を知っているかと問われて)大知りさ(あれは僕の小父だものなど)
Yes, rather―I should rather think so.
(あの人は金があるかと問われて)大有りさ
Yes, rather―I should rather think so.

content:
おおあたま〔大頭〕
〈名〉A chief; a leader; a boss; a swell; a conspicuous figure; a prominent figure; a great gun

content.content: 政界の大頭
leaders in politics―conspicuous figures in the political world
彼は政界の大頭だ
He is a swell in politics.

content:
おおあたり〔大当たり〕
〈名〉A great hit; a big success; a bonanza (in speculation, etc.)

content.content: 芝居は大当たりだ
The play has made a great hit.
昨夜の会は大当たりだった
Last night's meeting was a big success.
山は大当たりだ
My speculation has turned out a bonanza.
今年の養蚕は大当たりだ
This year's sericulture has turned out very well.

content:
おおあつあつ〔大熱々〕
〈形〉(To be) in the flush of love, madly in love

content.content: 二人は大アツアツだ
They are madly in love with each other.
まだ大アツアツだ
They are in the flush of love.

content:
おおあな〔大穴〕
〈名〉A hole, a gap, a deficit (in the accounts)

content.content: 大穴を明けた
I have made a hole ［a gap, a deficit］ in the accounts.
番頭が大穴を明けた
The head-clerk has been peculating on a large scale.
近頃の物入りで身代に大穴が明いた
My late outlays have left a large gap in my finances.

content:
おおあめ〔大雨〕
〈名〉A heavy rain; a downpour

content.content: 大雨が降っている
It is raining cats and dogs.

おおあらし〔大嵐〕
〈名〉A severe storm

おおあれ〔大荒れ〕
〈名〉A severe storm

content:
おおい〔多い〕
〈形〉
1. (=数が多い)many; numerous

content.content: 人数が多い
There are many persons.
知っている者が多い
Many people know.
知らない者が多い
There are many people who do not know.
日本人には英語を話す者が多い
Many Japanese speak English.
世に書多し
There are many books in the world―Books, their name is legion.
英学者は多い
There are many English scholars.
あの人は癖が多い
He has many faults.
この流行病は軍隊に多い
There are many cases of the epidemic in the army.
太平洋に島が多い
There are many islands in the Pacific Ocean―Numerous islands are found in the Pacific Ocean.
先生は著述が多い
His writings are numerous.
今年は生徒が少し多い
There are a few more students than usual this year.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 海軍には薩州人が多い
Satsuma men predominate in the army.
あの家は蠅が多い
The house swarms with flies.
向島は蚊が多い
Mukojima swarms with mosquitoes.
神田は学生が多い
Kanda swarms with students.
台湾は蛇が多い
Formosa crawls with snakes.
彼の文章は漢語が多い
His style bristles with Chinese expressions.
この本はむずかしい言葉が多い
The book bristles with hard words.
この本は誤植が多い
The book is full of misprints.
今年は入学志願者が非常に多かった
The school was deluged with applications for entrance this year.
この事業は困難が多い
The undertaking is beset with difficulties.
この企画は危険が多い
The enterprise is fraught with dangers.
日本は山が多い
Japan is mountainous.

content: 2. (=量が多い)much

content.content: 日本は雨が多い
There is much rain―Much rain falls―It rains much―in Japan.
越後は雪が多い
Much snow falls in Echigo―Echigo is a snowy country.
今年は雪が少し多い
It snows rather more than usual this year.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: アイヌ人は毛が多い
The Ainos are hairy.
この果物は汁が多い
This fruit is juicy―succulent.
この商売は利益が多い
The business is lucrative.
この土地は砂が多い
The soil is sandy.

content: 3. (=度数が多い)frequent

content.content: 東京は火事が多い
Fires are frequent―of frequent occurrence―in Tokyo.
日本は地震が多い
Japan is subject to frequent earthquakes.

content: 4. (=沢山ある)abundant; plentiful

content.content: 日本は物産が多い
Japan is rich in products.
北海道は海産物が多い
Marine products are abundant in Hokkaido―Marine products abound in Hokkaido―Hokkaido abounds in marine products―Hokkaido is rich in marine products.
日本は魚類が多い
Fish is plentiful in Japan―There is plenty of fish in Japan.
日本の沿海は魚類が多い
The seas about Japan teem with fish.
十九世紀は発見や発明が多かった
The Nineteenth Century was fruitful in discoveries and inventions.

content: 〈副〉(=しばしばある)often; frequently; in many cases; on many occasions

content.content: 彼は晩に出かけることが多い
He often goes out in the evening.
彼は学校を休むことが多い
He frequently absents himself from school.
この品は切れることが多い
It frequently happens that the article is out of stock.
酒が毒になることが多い(人が多い)
Wine does harm in many cases.
この言葉を使うことが多い
This word is used on many occasions.

content:
おおい〔覆い〕
〈名〉A cover; a mantle (of darkness); a coat (of earth); a cloak (of deception); a casing (for a machine); a shade (over the eye)

content.content: 覆いをする
to cover anything
死骸は白衣の覆いがしてある
The body is covered with white cloth.
覆いを去る
to uncover anything

content:
おおいさ〔大いさ〕
〈名〉Size; magnitude; dimensions; proportions

content.content: その動物は大いさがどれほどあるか
What is the size of the animal?―How large is the animal?
猫くらいの大いさだ
It is about the size of a cat―about as large as a cat.
大いさは猫の倍ある
It is twice the size of a cat―twice as large as a cat.
支那は大いさ日本の二十倍ある
China is twenty times the size of Japan―twenty times as large as Japan.
雄と雌とは大いさでわかる
You can tell the male from the female by their size.
物の大いさを見積る
to size up anything

content:
おおいそぎ〔大急ぎ〕
〈名〉Great haste; great hurry; urgency:(=の) urgent; pressing:(=で) in a great hurry; with all haste; in hot haste; post-haste; with all speed; with breathless speed; with flying feet; hotfoot; against time

content.content: 僕は大急ぎだ
I am in a great hurry.
大急ぎの用がある
I have urgent business―pressing business.
大急ぎで仕事を済ました
I finished my work with all haste―I rushed my work.
大急ぎで駈けつけた
I hurried to the scene in hot haste―with all speed―with breathless speed―with flying feet―I hurried hotfoot to the scene.
大急ぎで旅行する(汽車の無い時)
to travel post
僕式を大急ぎですました
The ceremony was hurried through―rushed through.
大急ぎで用を片づけた
I despatched the business in a great hurry―I rushed the business.
朝飯も食わずに大急ぎで出かけた
I hurried out without waiting to eat my breakfast.
大急ぎで本を印刷した
I rushed into print.
議案を大急ぎで通過さした
The bill was rushed through the House.
大急ぎで書いている
I am writing against time.
大急ぎで読んでいる
I am reading against time.

おおいちざ〔大一座〕
〈名〉A combined company of actors

content:
おおいなる〔大いなる〕
〈形〉Large; great; big; grand; vast; gigantic; colossal

content.content: そう思うのは大いなる誤りである
It is a great mistake to think so.
彼は大いなる身代をこしらえた
He has made a large fortune―a vast fortune.
大いなる策をめぐらす
to revolve a gigantic scheme―a colossal scheme

content:
おおいに〔大いに〕
〈副〉(Very) much; greatly; largely; highly; deeply; widely; heavily; badly; seriously; considerably; far; a great deal; a good deal; to a great extent; in a great measure

content.content: これはあれに大いに勝る
This is much better―far better―than that.
大いに失望した
I am greatly disappointed.
彼の成功は大いに僥倖に起因す
His success is largely due to luck.
結果を見て大いに満足した
I am highly pleased with the result.
大いにその必要を感じている
I am deeply impressed with its importance.
彼はこの取引によって大いに損失を招いた
He lost heavily by this transaction.
この金は大いに必要だ
I need the money badly.
これとあれとは大いに違う
This is widely different from that.
一つ多いと少ないとでは大いに違う
One more or less makes a material difference.
この出来事は大いに計画の妨害になる
The occurrence seriously interferes with my plans.
米価が大いに騰貴した
The price of rice has gone up considerably.
彼の助力が成功に大いに与って力がある
His assistance contributed a great deal to my success.
事の成敗は大いに彼の向背による
The success of the affair will depend to a great extent on his attitude―Success will depend in a great measure on his attitude.
君と大いに論じなければならぬことがある
I must have it out with you.

content:
おおいり〔大入り〕
〈名〉A large house; a full house; a crowded house

content.content: 芝居は大入りだ
The play is drawing a large house.
今度の芝居は連日大入客止の盛況である
The new play draws a full house every day.
忠臣蔵をやるときっと大入りだ
The Chushingura is sure to draw crowded houses.

content:
おおう〔蔽う、覆う、掩う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=蔽い被ぶさる)to cover; to overspread; to hang over (a scene); to brood over (a scene)

content.content: 黒雲天を蔽う
Black clouds cover the sky―The sky is covered with black clouds.
頂上は雪に蔽わる
The summit is covered with snow.
野は花に蔽わる
The field is overspread with flowers―decked with flowers.
彼女は手巾をもって顔を蔽うた
She covered her face with her handkerchief―(と言うよりも普通は)―buried her face in her handkerchief.
静粛の気全都を蔽う
Silence hangs over―broods over―the whole city.
神霊深みを覆う
“The spirit of God brooded over the deep.”
革命の暗雲露独の天を蔽う
Dark clouds of revolution hung over Russia and Germany.
硝煙戦場を蔽う
A canopy of sulphurous smoke floated over the battlefield.
一言もってこれを蔽う
The matter lies in a nutshell.
棺を蔽うて事定まる
“Call no man happy before he is dead.”

content: 2. (=掩い隠す)to veil; to conceal; to hide; to disguise

content.content: (西洋婦人の様に)面部を掩う
to veil oneself
彼女は面部を掩うている
She is veiled.
大和民族の起原は隠密に掩わる
The origin of the Yamato race is veiled in mystery.
人の短所を掩う
to draw a veil over another's faults
己が非を掩う
to conceal one's faults
事実掩うべからず
The fact is not to be disguised―The fact stares us in the face.
掩うべからさる事実だ
It is a patent fact.
人間の運命は秘密に掩わる
A mystery hangs over man's destiny.

content: 3. (=覆い包む)to wrap; to envelop; to shroud

content.content: 大和民族の起原は隠密に覆わる
The origin of the Yamato race in wrapped in mystery―enveloped in mystery―shrouded in mystery.
全市暗黒に覆わる
The whole city was wrapped in darkness.
頂上は霧に覆われている
The peak is enveloped in mist.
山々は緑葉に覆わる
The hills are clad in verdure.
人の目を覆う
to blindfold one
自分の耳を覆う
to stop one's ears―place one's hands over one's ears
耳を覆うて鈴を盗む
“The cat shuts her eyes while she steals the cream.”

content: 4. (=暗くする) to obscure (the sun); to shade (a luminous object)

content.content: 太陽が雲に掩われる
The sun is obscured by a cloud.
電灯を掩う
to shade an electric light
木が日を掩う
Trees keep off the sun.
樹木が市街を掩う
Trees shade the streets.

content:
おおう〔蔽う、覆う、掩う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=蔽い被ぶさる)to cover; to overspread; to hang over (a scene); to brood over (a scene)

content.content: 黒雲天を蔽う
Black clouds cover the sky―The sky is covered with black clouds.
頂上は雪に蔽わる
The summit is covered with snow.
野は花に蔽わる
The field is overspread with flowers―decked with flowers.
彼女は手巾をもって顔を蔽うた
She covered her face with her handkerchief―(と言うよりも普通は)―buried her face in her handkerchief.
静粛の気全都を蔽う
Silence hangs over―broods over―the whole city.
神霊深みを覆う
“The spirit of God brooded over the deep.”
革命の暗雲露独の天を蔽う
Dark clouds of revolution hung over Russia and Germany.
硝煙戦場を蔽う
A canopy of sulphurous smoke floated over the battlefield.
一言もってこれを蔽う
The matter lies in a nutshell.
棺を蔽うて事定まる
“Call no man happy before he is dead.”

content: 2. (=掩い隠す)to veil; to conceal; to hide; to disguise

content.content: (西洋婦人の様に)面部を掩う
to veil oneself
彼女は面部を掩うている
She is veiled.
大和民族の起原は隠密に掩わる
The origin of the Yamato race is veiled in mystery.
人の短所を掩う
to draw a veil over another's faults
己が非を掩う
to conceal one's faults
事実掩うべからず
The fact is not to be disguised―The fact stares us in the face.
掩うべからさる事実だ
It is a patent fact.
人間の運命は秘密に掩わる
A mystery hangs over man's destiny.

content: 3. (=覆い包む)to wrap; to envelop; to shroud

content.content: 大和民族の起原は隠密に覆わる
The origin of the Yamato race in wrapped in mystery―enveloped in mystery―shrouded in mystery.
全市暗黒に覆わる
The whole city was wrapped in darkness.
頂上は霧に覆われている
The peak is enveloped in mist.
山々は緑葉に覆わる
The hills are clad in verdure.
人の目を覆う
to blindfold one
自分の耳を覆う
to stop one's ears―place one's hands over one's ears
耳を覆うて鈴を盗む
“The cat shuts her eyes while she steals the cream.”

content: 4. (=暗くする) to obscure (the sun); to shade (a luminous object)

content.content: 太陽が雲に掩われる
The sun is obscured by a cloud.
電灯を掩う
to shade an electric light
木が日を掩う
Trees keep off the sun.
樹木が市街を掩う
Trees shade the streets.

content:
おおう〔蔽う、覆う、掩う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=蔽い被ぶさる)to cover; to overspread; to hang over (a scene); to brood over (a scene)

content.content: 黒雲天を蔽う
Black clouds cover the sky―The sky is covered with black clouds.
頂上は雪に蔽わる
The summit is covered with snow.
野は花に蔽わる
The field is overspread with flowers―decked with flowers.
彼女は手巾をもって顔を蔽うた
She covered her face with her handkerchief―(と言うよりも普通は)―buried her face in her handkerchief.
静粛の気全都を蔽う
Silence hangs over―broods over―the whole city.
神霊深みを覆う
“The spirit of God brooded over the deep.”
革命の暗雲露独の天を蔽う
Dark clouds of revolution hung over Russia and Germany.
硝煙戦場を蔽う
A canopy of sulphurous smoke floated over the battlefield.
一言もってこれを蔽う
The matter lies in a nutshell.
棺を蔽うて事定まる
“Call no man happy before he is dead.”

content: 2. (=掩い隠す)to veil; to conceal; to hide; to disguise

content.content: (西洋婦人の様に)面部を掩う
to veil oneself
彼女は面部を掩うている
She is veiled.
大和民族の起原は隠密に掩わる
The origin of the Yamato race is veiled in mystery.
人の短所を掩う
to draw a veil over another's faults
己が非を掩う
to conceal one's faults
事実掩うべからず
The fact is not to be disguised―The fact stares us in the face.
掩うべからさる事実だ
It is a patent fact.
人間の運命は秘密に掩わる
A mystery hangs over man's destiny.

content: 3. (=覆い包む)to wrap; to envelop; to shroud

content.content: 大和民族の起原は隠密に覆わる
The origin of the Yamato race in wrapped in mystery―enveloped in mystery―shrouded in mystery.
全市暗黒に覆わる
The whole city was wrapped in darkness.
頂上は霧に覆われている
The peak is enveloped in mist.
山々は緑葉に覆わる
The hills are clad in verdure.
人の目を覆う
to blindfold one
自分の耳を覆う
to stop one's ears―place one's hands over one's ears
耳を覆うて鈴を盗む
“The cat shuts her eyes while she steals the cream.”

content: 4. (=暗くする) to obscure (the sun); to shade (a luminous object)

content.content: 太陽が雲に掩われる
The sun is obscured by a cloud.
電灯を掩う
to shade an electric light
木が日を掩う
Trees keep off the sun.
樹木が市街を掩う
Trees shade the streets.

content:
おおうけ〔大受け〕
〈名〉A great success

content.content: 嬢は帝劇で大受けだ
She has made a great hit at the Imperial Theatre.
京都で大受けだった
She took Kyoto by storm.
到る所で大受けだ
She enjoys great popularity everywhere she goes.

おおうそ〔大嘘〕
〈名〉A whopping lie; a swingeing lie; a bouncing lie; a bouncer

おおうち〔大内〕
〈名〉The Imperial Palace

おおうちやま〔大内山〕
〈名〉The palace grounds

おおうなばら〔大海原〕
〈名〉The waste of waters

おおうみ〔大海〕
〈名〉The open sea; the ocean

content:
おおうりだし〔大売出し〕
〈名〉A great opening sale

content.content: 歳暮大売出し
a great year-end sale

おおおく〔大奥〕
〈名〉The inner palace; the harem

おおおじ〔大叔父、大伯父〕
〈名〉A great-uncle

おおおじ〔大叔父、大伯父〕
〈名〉A great-uncle

content:
おおおとこ〔大男〕
〈名〉A big man; a giant

content.content: 雲付くばかりの大男
a towering giant
大男総身に智慧がまわりかね
“Big and empty”―“Big head, little wit.”
総身に智慧のまわりかねるような大男だ
He is a big hulking fellow.

おおおば〔大叔母、大伯母〕
〈名〉A great-aunt

おおおば〔大叔母、大伯母〕
〈名〉A great-aunt

content:
おおが〔大鋸〕
〈名〉A large saw

content.content: オガくず
sawdust

content:
おおかぜ〔大風〕
〈名〉A gale; a hurricane

content.content: 大風が吹いている
It is blowing a gale―It is blowing great guns.
大風の後のようだ
It is as if a hurricane had blown over.
大風の後の快晴
“After a storm comes a calm.”

content:
おおかた〔大方〕
〈副〉
1. (=大部分は)mostly; for the most part

content.content: 生徒はおおかた地方の者だ
The students are mostly from the provinces―They are, for the most part, from the provinces.

content: 2. (=多分)probably; perhaps

content.content: おおかたそんなことだろう
Perhaps it is so.
彼はおおかた来るだろう
He will probably come―In all probability, he will come.
おおかた何かの間違いだろう
It must be some mistake.
おおかたこんなことだろうと思った
I knew how it would be―I was prepared for this.

content: 3. (=おおよそ)nearly; almost

content.content: 普請はおおかたでき上がった
The building is very nearly completed.
試験はおおかたすんだ
The examinations are almost over.

content:
おおがた〔大形〕
〈形〉Large-sized

content.content: この時計の方は少し大形です
This watch is rather large-sized.

content:
おおがねもち〔大金持〕
〈名〉A millionaire; a Croesus

content.content: 彼は大金持ちだ
He is a Croesus―He rolls in riches.
大金持ちになる
to make a fortune
彼は(金持ちの後を継いで)にわかに大金持ちになった
He has stepped into a fortune.

content:
おおかみ〔狼〕
〈名〉The wolf

content.content: 狼が吼える
A wolf howls.
前門に虎、後門に狼
“between the devil and the deep sea.”

content:
おおがら〔大柄〕
〈形〉
1. (=身体の大柄)of a large build

content.content: 大柄の女だ
She is of a large build―a large-built woman.

content: 2. (=模様の大柄)of a large pattern

content.content: 大柄の着物
a gown of a large pattern

content:
おおきい〔大きい〕
〈形〉Large; great; big; grand:(非常に大きい)huge; monstrous; gigantic; colossal

content.content: この座敷の方が畳二畳だけ大きい
This room is larger than the other by two mats.
大きな国
a large country
大きな身代
a large fortune
大きな人物
a great figure
大きな男
a big fellow
彼は気が大きい
He is generous―liberal.
気が大き過ぎる
He is generous to a fault.
心が大きい
He has a broad mind―He is broad-minded.
腹が大きい
He has a large heart―(女なら)―She is with child―in the family way.
からだが大きい
He is a big fellow.
年にしては大きい
He is a tall boy of his age.
人間が大きい
He is a man of large calibre.
胆玉が大きい
He is magnanimous.
君は目の着け処が大きい
You take a large view of the matter.
逃がした魚は大きい
“A thing is the bigger for being lost.”
大きい声
a loud voice
彼は大きい声で話をする
He talks loudly―in a loud voice.
もう少し大きい声で
Please speak a little louder!
大きい声では言えないがあれは山師だ
Between ourselves, he is an impostor.
大きな目で眺めている
He was staring with his eyes wide open―with wide-open eyes.
芸が大きい
His acting is grand.
彼は大きなことを言う
He talks big―talks tall.
大きくやっている
He keeps a large house―keeps a large establishment.

content:
おおきく〔大きく〕
〈副〉In large; on a large scale

content.content: 大きくなる
to grow larger―increase in size―(成長してなら)―grow―grow up
東京、大阪は大きくなる
Tokyo and Osaka are increasing in size.
彼の代になって身代が大きくなった
His fortune has grown larger in his hands.
坊や、大きくなったね
How you have grown, my boy!
早く大きくなって偉くおなりなさい
You must make haste and grow up to be a great man.
子どもが大きくなって着物が小さくなる
The boy outgrows his clothes.
火事が大きくなる
A fire spreads.
彼は少し金を持つとすぐ気が大きくなる
The possession of a little money makes him generous.
大きくする
to make anything larger―enlarge―aggrandize―magnify
身代を大きくする
to enlarge one's fortune
家を大きくする
to aggrandize the house
店を大きくする
to extend the business
目を大きくして眺めた
He stared with his eyes wide open―with wide-open eyes.
騒ぎを大きくする
to add fuel to the fire―pour oil on the fire
大きく言う
to exaggerate―magnify―stretch the truth―make a mountain of a mole-hill
彼は大きくやっている
He keeps a large house―keeps a large establishment.
大きく商売をしている
He does business in large―on a large scale.
大きく出る
to come out with a bouncer―ask an exorbitant price
一万円、大きく出たな
Ten thousand yen? That's a bouncer.
上衣を大きく仕立ててくれ
Cut my coat full―I want my coat cut full.
気を大きく持て
Do not worry over trifles!―Take life like a philosopher!

content:
おおきさ〔大きさ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おおいさ〔大いさ〕

content:
おおきな〔大きな〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: おおきい〔大きい〕
大きなことを言う
to talk big―talk tall.
彼は大きなことばかり言ってなに一つできない
He is all talk and no deed.
大きな顔をする
to look big
大きなことをする
to do a great thing―perform a great deed
大きな考えを起こす
to conceive a great scheme
大きなお世話だ
It is no business of your―Mind your own business!
自分の物は煮て食おうと焼いて食おうと大きなお世話だ
It is none of your business what I do with my own.
これとあれとは大きな違い
This is widely different from that.
見ると聞くとは大きな違い
The reality falls far short of the fame.

content:
おおきに〔大きに〕
〈副〉Very much; greatly

content.content: 大きにありがとう
Many thanks!―A thousand thanks!
大きにご苦労でした
Many thanks for your trouble!
大きにご無沙汰致しました
I must apologize for neglecting you so long.
病人は大きによろしい
The invalid is much better.
大きにお世話になりました
You have been very good to me.
大きにそうです
It is certainly as you say―Exactly―You may well say that.

おおぎみ〔大君〕
〈名〉One's sovereign lord; the Emperor

content:
おおぎょう〔大形〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: おおげさ〔大袈裟〕

おおぎり〔大切り〕
〈名〉
1. (=結末)an end; a close; a termination; a conclusion
2. (=芝居の大切り)the after-piece

content:
おおく〔多く〕
〈形〉
1. ［数］Many (friends); most (people); numerous (writings, etc.)

content.content: 彼は多くの人に接する
He comes in contact with many people.
人は多くはそう思う
Most people think so.
学生の多くは地方から出ている
Most of the students are from the provinces―The students are mostly from the provinces―The students are, for the most part, from the provinces.
彼は多くの本を読んでいる
He has read extensively―His reading is extensive.

content: 2. ［量］Much (money); abundant (food); plenty of (money, etc.)

content.content: 彼はこの事業には多くの金を費している
He has laid out much money on the undertaking.
海には多くの食物がある
There is abundant food in the sea.
少し多く持って来い
Bring a little more than usual!

content: 〈副〉Much; mostly; for the most part; largely; to a great extent

content.content: この習慣は多く軍人間に行われる
The custom prevails much among soldiers.
この品は多くは支那向きです
These goods are mostly destined for China.
成功は多くは僥倖だ
Success is largely due to chance.
彼の言うことは多くはあたっている
What he says, is true to a great extent.
彼は多くも百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million, at most―at the outside.

content:
おおぐい〔大食い〕
〈名〉
1. (=暴食)gluttony; gormandize; voracity:(=する) to gluttonize; to gormandize; to devour; to raven; to stuff; to gorge oneself; to glut oneself:(=な) gluttonous, voracious, ravenous (eater, etc.)
2. (=暴食家)a glutton; a gourmand; a cormorant

content.content: 君もなかなか大食いだね
What a glutton you are!
学童は大食いなものだ
A school-boy has a wolf in his stomach.

content:
おおくち〔大口〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おおぐち〔大口〕

content:
おおぐち〔大口〕
〈名〉
1. (=大きく明いた口)an open mouth

content.content: 大口を明く
to open one's mouth wide―gape
大口を明いて待っている
They wait with their mouths wide open―They wait agape.

content: 2. (=大言)boasting; bragging; big talk; tall talk

content.content: 大口を利く
to boast―brag―talk big―talk tall

content: 3. (=猥褻な言葉)obscene talk; bawdy talk; indecent language; broad jests; ribaldry; bawdy

content.content: 大口を利く
to talk bawdy―talk ribaldry
彼は大口を利いて一座を笑わせる
He sets the table in a roar by his broad jests.

content: 〈形〉(=大きな)large

content.content: 大口の金
large sums of money
大口の註文
large orders
大口の買い物
large purchases

content:
おおくみても〔多く見ても〕
〈副〉At most; at the outside

content.content: 彼は多く見ても百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million, at most.

おおくらしょう〔大蔵省〕
〈名〉The Finance Department:(英国にては)the Exchequer:(米国にては)the Treasury Department

おおくらだいじん〔大蔵大臣〕
〈名〉The Minister of (State for) Finance

content:
おおげさ〔大袈裟〕
〈形〉
1. (=誇大な)exaggerated (story); hyperbolical (statement); magnified (description, etc.):(=に) with a flourish of trumpets

content.content: 大袈裟に言う
to exaggerate the truth―stretch the truth―magnify the truth―pile it up―make a mountain of a mole-hill
大袈裟な話
an exaggeration
あの人の話はちと大袈裟だ
He is given to exaggeration―He will make a mountain of a mole-hill.
そう大袈裟に吹聴しなくともよい
You need not announce it with a flourish of trumpets.
あの人の約束は大袈裟だ
He makes sounding promises.

content: 2. (=大仕掛けの)on a large scale

content.content: 米国は農工業とも大袈裟だ
In America, agriculture and industry are conducted on a large scale.

content:
おおごえ〔大声〕
〈名〉A loud voice; a stentorian voice:(=で) in a loud voice; loudly

content.content: 君は大声を出すから子どもが目を覚ます
You talk so loudly that you awaken the child.
大声でどなった
I shouted at the top of my voice.

おおごしょ〔大御所〕
〈名〉A retired prince; a retired shogun

content:
おおごと〔大事〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: だいじ〔大事〕

おおざけのみ〔大酒飲み〕
〈名〉A deep drinker; a hard drinker; a heavy drinker

content:
おおざっぱ〔大ざっぱ〕
〈形〉Rough; loose:(=に) roughly; loosely

content.content: 大ざっぱに見積る
to make a rough estimate
大ざっぱな話をする人だ
He indulges in loose talk.

content:
おおさわぎ〔大騒ぎ〕
〈名〉
1. Hubbub; a hurly-burly; a turmoil; a tumult; a racket; a row; a rumpus; a shindy; a storm; an uproar; a clamour; a bustle; a fuss; hue and cry; much ado; great trouble; great excitement

content.content: 議会は満堂鼎の沸くが如き大騒ぎ
The House was in an uproar.
戦争のような大騒ぎが始まっている
There is a great hubbub going on.
家の中は上を下への大騒ぎ
The house is in a great bustle―in a turmoil―topsyturvy.
試験問題が漏れて大騒ぎになった
The divulgence of examination papers gave rise to great trouble.
大騒ぎをする
to make a fuss―raise a clamour―raise a hue and cry
金が無くなったとてそんな大騒ぎをすることは無い
You need not make such a fuss about the loss of money.
子どもがいなくなって大騒ぎをした
We raised a hue and cry over the lost child.
大騒ぎをして迷子を捜した
We searched for the lost child with hue and cry.
つまらぬことに大騒ぎする(大山鳴動して鼠一匹)
to make a fuss about trifles―make much ado about nothing
大騒ぎを起こす
to cause an excitement―(暴れてなら)―make a rumpus―raise a racket―kick up a shindy
ペストで大騒ぎをした
The pest caused a great excitement.
女どもが男に大騒ぎをする
Girls make much of a man.
彼は女どもに大騒ぎをされる
He is made much of―much run after―by the girls.

content:
おおしい〔雄々しい〕
〈形〉Manly; manful; virile

content.content: 雄々しい振る舞い
manly behaviour
雄々しい振る舞いをする
to behave manfully―play the man

おおじか〔大鹿〕
〈名〉The elk:(米国のは)the moose

content:
おおじかけ〔大仕掛〕
〈名〉A large scale

content.content: 米国では農工業とも大仕掛だ
In America, agriculture and industry are conducted on a large scale.
あの人の計画は皆非常な大仕掛だ
His projects are all conceived on a colossal scale.

おおしたてる〔生し立てる〕
〈他動〉To bring up (a child); to educate (a child)

content:
おおじぬし〔大地主〕
〈名〉A great land-owner

content.content: 英国の貴族はたいがい大地主だ
Most English noblemen are lords of broad acres.

おおしめ〔大〆〕
〈名〉The grand total

content:
おおず〔大図〕
〈名〉The substance, the sum and substance, the general outline (of a plan, etc.)

content.content: 大図だけをわからしておくことにしよう
I will give you a general idea of the plan.

content:
おおすぎる〔多過ぎる〕
〈自動〉(数なら)there are too many:(量なら)there is too much:(どれも)to be in excess

content.content: 中学校の学科は多過ぎる
The middle-school curriculum contains too many branches.
今年は雨が多過ぎる
We have too much rain this year.
数が多過ぎる
There are too many―The number is in excess.
目方が三斤多過ぎる
The weight is three pounds in excess.
職員が多過ぎる
The staff is overmanned―The office is overstaffed.
この職業は人が多過ぎる
The profession is crowded.
人の多過ぎる職業
a crowded profession

content:
おおせ〔仰せ〕
〈名〉What you say; your statement; your command; your orders; your wishes

content.content: 仰せの通り
You are right―So it is.
仰せごもっとも
What you say, is true―I admit the truth of your statement―I admit the fact.
仰せは一応ごもっともですが
What you say is all very well, but...
仰せに従います
I shall obey you―obey your wishes.
仰せに従い参ります
I shall be there in obedience to your wishes.
ぜひとの仰せならなんにも申しません
If you will have it so, I shall say nothing against it.
私にぜひとどまれと仰せならとどまりも致しましょう
If you will have me stay,I shall stay.
私に去れとの仰せですか
Do you wish me to leave?―Would you have me leave?
どうせよとの仰せですか
What do you wish me to do?―What would you have me do?
何でも仰せのままになります
I am at your beck and call.

content:
おおぜい〔大勢〕
〈名〉Many people; a great number of people; a large company; a large force; a crowd; a multitude; a host:(=で) in great numbers; in great force

content.content: 明日は大勢に来られる
I shall have many people come tomorrow.
玄関に大勢待っている
There is a crowd at the door―The door is besieged by a crowd.
大勢の前で恥をかかされた
I was insulted before a large company.
彼は大勢子どもがある
He has a large family of children―a large family to provide for.
彼は大勢兄弟がある
He is one of a large family.
彼は大勢人を使っておく
He keeps a large establishment.
大勢で押しかけよう
Let us go in great numbers!
観光団は大勢で来た
The tourists came in great force.
大勢で行って反対者を圧倒しよう
Let us go in such numbers as to bear down opposition.
大勢の眼鏡は違わぬ
The number of witnesses is a strong presumption that they are right―“There is safety in numbers.”

content:

〈他動〉To announce (an Imperial intention)

content.content: 博覧会行幸仰せ出さる

謁見仰付けらる

本日陛下には外国使臣に謁見仰付けらる
Today the Emperor will give audience to the foreign representatives.
町奉行仰付けられた

閉門仰付けられた

おおせらる〔仰せらる〕
〈他動〉(Honorific for) to say

content:
おおせる〔遂せる〕
〈接尾動詞〉To succeed in (doing anything); to manage to (do anything)

content.content: 逃げ遂せる
to make good one's escape―effect one's escape
君はよくそんなことが仕遂せるな
How do you manage to do that?
君に辛抱が仕遂せるかどうか疑問だ
I doubt if you can hold out to the end.

content:
おおそうじ〔大掃除〕

content.content: 大掃除をする

content.content: おおさわぎ〔大騒ぎ〕

content.content: おおぞら〔大空〕

content:

content.content: 彼は政界の大立物だ

文壇の大立物だ
He is a great figure of the literary arena―a literary lion.

content:
おおだてもの〔大立物〕
〈名〉A great figure; a great gun

content.content: 彼は政界の大立物だ

content:

content.content: 見ると聞くとは大違い
The reality falls far short of the fame.
口と腹とは大違い
He says one thing and means quite another thing.
僕を三十と見たのか大違いだ
Do you take me for thirty? You are wide of the mark.

おおづかみ〔大摘み〕
〈形〉Rough; broad:(=に) roughly; broadly

おおづつ〔大筒〕

content:

to swing one's arms

(試験など)大手を振って通過した
He came off with flying colours.
大手を拡げる

大手を拡げて歓迎する
to receive one with open arms

content:

The social gathering was a big success.
今度の試験は大出来だ
You have done very well in the examination.

Koshiro was at his best last evening.
この作文は大出来だ
The composition is a masterpiece.
大出来、大出来(!)
Well done!―Bravo!

おおてもん〔大手門〕
〈名〉The front gate (of a castle)

おおどうぐ〔大道具〕

to effect reforms in the schools

to make a drastic cut in the Budget

content:

content.content: 大波が立っている

〈名〉A giant

content:
おおはずれ〔大外れ〕

content.content: 今度の芝居は大はずれだ

僕を三十と見たのか、大はずれだ
Do you take me for thirty? You are wide of the mark.

content:

content.content: 大幅の黒羅紗
broadcloth

content.content: 自動車が大ばやりだ
There is a craze for motoring―Motoring is the craze of the day―Motoring is all the mode―all the rage―all the go.

content:
おおばん〔大判〕

1. (=小判に対する大判)the obang
2. (=大形)a large size:(=の) large-sized

content.content: 大判の洋紙
foolscap

この事件は東京で大評判になった
The affair created quite a sensation in Tokyo.

content:
おおびらに〔大びらに〕
〈副〉Openly; publicly; in public; in the face of the world

content.content: 身分が身分だから大びらに遊ぶことはできない
His social position prevents his visiting gay quarters openly.
彼は今ではその女を大びらに連れて歩いている
He now takes her out in public.
西洋では大びらにばくちを打つ
In foreign countries, they gamble in the face of the world.
(娘子が言う)今日のお芝居は大びらよ
Today I go to the play with my mother's permission.

おおひろま〔大広間〕
〈名〉A grand hall

content:
おおびろま〔大広間〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おおひろま〔大広間〕

content:

〈名〉A heavy rainfall; a downpour

Yesterday's heavy rainfall has made the river rise.

おおぶり〔大振り〕
〈形〉Rather large-sized; of a rather large size

content.content: この傘はちと大振りです

content:
おおぶろしき〔大風呂敷〕

content.content: 大風呂敷を拡げる
to talk big―talk tall―indulge in braggadocio
彼の大風呂敷に当てられた
We were carried off our feet by his braggadocio.

おおぼら〔大法螺〕
〈名〉A bouncing lie; a bouncer

content:
おおまか〔大まか〕
〈形〉
1. (=大様)generous; liberal; open-handed

content.content: 彼は金使いが大まかだ
He is free with his money―generous with his money―liberal of his money.
大まかに暮らしている
He lives in liberal style.

content: 2. (=ざっとした)rough; general; broad

content.content: 大まかに言えば語学は男より女の方が好い
Roughly speaking,―Generally speaking,―Broadly speaking,―girls make better linguists than boys.
大まかに見積る
to make a rough estimate

content:
おおまけ〔大負け〕
〈名〉
1. (=大敗亡)a signal defeat; a heavy reverse

content.content: 攻撃軍は大負けをした
The assailants sustained a signal defeat―met with a heavy reverse.

content: 2. (=大減価)a great reduction in price

content.content: 大負けに負けておきます
It shall be a great bargain.
大負けに負けて十円にしておきましょう
I will come down as far as 10 yen.

content:
おおまた〔大股〕
〈名〉A great stride; a long stride

content.content: 大股に歩く
to stride along―walk with great strides
女が男のように大股に歩いてはおかしいわ
It is unbecoming in a girl to walk with big strides like a man.

content:
おおまちがい〔大間違い〕
〈名〉A great mistake; a gross error

content.content: 貧乏を不幸だと思うのは大間違いだ
It is a great mistake to think that poverty is a misfortune.
大間違いをした
I have made a great mistake.
そりゃ大間違いだ
You are greatly mistaken―as wrong as wrong can be.
僕を三十と見たのか、大間違いだ
Do you take me for thirty? You are wide of the mark.

content:
おおみず〔大水〕
〈名〉A flood; an inundation

content.content: 大水が出た
The country is inundated―flooded―in flood.
河は大水だ
The rivers are in flood―at their flood.
市街は大水だ
The streets are flooded―in flood.
大水で橋が落ちた
The flood has swept away the bridge.
大水で土手が切れた
The flood has burst the embankment.

content:
おおみそか〔大晦日〕
〈名〉The last day of the year; New Year's Eve

content.content: 大晦日は総勘定
All accounts are settled on New Year's Eve.

content:
おおみみ〔大耳〕
〈名〉Connivance

content.content: 大名は大耳

content.content: 麦酒は大麦より製す

content.content: 大向こうの人気を取る
to play to the gallery

content.content: たいがい〔大概〕

content.content: おおめにみる〔大目に見る〕

content:
おおめし〔大飯〕
〈名〉A hearty meal

content.content: 大飯を食う
to make a hearty meal
彼は大飯を食う
He is a hearty eater―He has a hearty appetite.

おおめしくい〔大飯食い〕
〈名〉A hearty eater

content:
おおめにみる〔大目に見る〕
〈他動〉To connive at, wink at, pass over, overlook (a fault); to look through one's fingers at (one's faults); to shut one's eyes to (one's faults); to make allowances for (one's ignorance, etc.)

content.content: 今度だけは大目に見てやる
I will overlook your fault for this once.
些細な過失は大目に見るが好し
It is best to wink at petty faults.
当局者は犯則を大目に見ている
The authorities connive at the offence.
子どもだから大目に見ておく
I will make allowances for his youth.

content:
おおもうけ〔大儲け〕
〈名〉A large profit; a large gain

content.content: 彼は大儲けをしている
He is making a good thing out of it.
株で大儲けをした
He has done a good thing in shares.

content:
おおもて〔大持て〕
〈名〉Being lionized

content.content: 大将は米国で大持てであった
The general was lionized―made a lion of―in America.

content:
おおもと〔大本〕
〈名〉The first cause; the original source; the fountain-head; the prime mover; the root:(学理などから)first principles

content.content: 戦争の大本は何であったか
What was the first cause of the war?
富国の大本は民の勉強である
The people's industry is the original source of national wealth.
その説は大本が間違っている
The theory is wrong at the root.
この制度は大本が腐敗している
The system is corrupt at the fountain-head.
一々干渉せずとも大本をしめくくっておればよい
Instead of interfering in everything, you need only keep the prime mover under control.

おおや〔大屋〕
〈名〉The landlord (of a tenement-house)

おおやくどし〔大厄年〕
〈名〉The grand climacteric

content:
おおやけ〔公〕
〈名〉
1. (=公衆)the public
2. (=政府)the government
3. (=朝廷)the Court; the Imperial Court
4. (=公務)public affairs; official duties
〈形〉(=表向きの)public; open; official; formal:(=に) publicly; in public; openly; officially; formally

content.content: 公の事と私の事を区別する
to draw the line between public and private matters
まだ公の通知は無い
We have received no official notice yet.
任命はまだ公には発表にならぬ
The appointment is not officially announced yet.
公に結婚はせぬ
They were not married in public.
公に攻撃はし得ない
They dare not attack me openly―make an open attack on me.
事を公にする
to make anything public―publish the matter―give publicity to an affair
彼の著述は公にされなかった
His writings were not published.
この事件は公にしない方がよい
It is unadvisable to make the matter public―give publicity to the affair.

content:
おおやけざた〔公沙汰〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おもてざた〔表沙汰〕

content:
おおやすうり〔大安売〕
〈名〉A great bargain

content.content: 破天荒の大安売
a record-breaking bargain-day

おおゆき〔大雪〕
〈名〉A heavy snowfall

おおゆみ〔弩〕
〈名〉A crossbow; an arbalest

content:
おおよそ〔大凡〕
〈副〉Roughly; approximately; about; in round numbers:(=の) rough; approximate

content.content: この戦争でおおよそ三十万人は死んでいる
Those killed in this war were 300,000 in round numbers.
おおよその見積り
a rough estimate―an approximate estimate
おおよそのところどのくらいかかりますか
What is the approximate cost?
損害はおおよそどんなものか
What is the approximate loss?
君は負債がおおよそどのくらいあるか
What is the approximate extent of your liabilities?

content:
おおわらい〔大笑い〕
〈名〉A hearty laugh; a good laugh; a roar of laughter:(=する) to roar with laughter

content.content: あの人が来ると一座が大笑いする
He sets the table in a roar.
これでは大笑いさ
We had a good laugh over the matter.

おおわるもの〔大悪者〕
〈名〉An arrant knave; a notorious scoundrel

おか〔岡〕
〈名〉A hill; a hillock; a height; a rising ground

content:
おか〔陸〕
〈名〉(海河に対しては)land:(船に対しては)shore

content.content: 救命艇は無事に陸に着いた
The life-boat came safe to land.
河へ飛び込んで子どもを陸へ上げた
I plunged into the river, and brought the child safe to land.
(船から)陸へ行く
to go on shore
誰か陸へ行く人はありませんか
Is any one going on shore?

おかあさん〔お母さん〕
〈名〉Mother; mamma; ma

content:
おかいこぐるみ〔お蚕ぐるみ〕
〈名〉Being dressed in silk:(より)luxury

content.content: 彼はお蚕ぐるみで暮らしている
He is lapped in luxury.
お蚕ぐるみで育った
He was brought up in luxury.

content:
おがくず〔大鋸屑〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おおがくず〔大鋸屑〕

content:
おかげ〔お蔭〕
〈名〉Indebtedness

content.content: お蔭で
owing to―due to―thanks to―some cause
君のお蔭で成功した
I have succeeded owing to your assistance―It is all owing to you that I have succeeded―I owe you my success―I am indebted to you for my success―I must thank you for my success.
僕の成功したのは君の助力のお蔭です
My success is due to your assistance.
彼の成功したのは僥倖のお蔭だ
His success is due to luck―due to chance.
お蔭で失敗した
It is all owing to you that I have failed―I owe you my failure―I am indebted to you for my failure―I must thank you for my failure.
お蔭で命が助かりました、あなたは命の親だ
I owe you my life―You have saved my life―You are the preserver of my life.
私がこうなったのはあなたのお蔭です、あなたは私にとっては出世の親です
You have made me what I am―You have been the making of me―I owe you everything in life.
お蔭でこうなった―身を誤った―堕落した
You have made me what I am―You have been the unmaking of me―I owe you my ruin.
お蔭でこの家も滅亡を免れました
It is all owing to you that the house has escaped ruin―It is through you that the house has escaped ruin―You have saved the house from ruin.
科学のお蔭で肺病が治るようになった
Owing to science,―Thanks to science,―people now recover from consumption.
お蔭様で病気も全快しました
(医者に向かって言えば)I must thank you for my recovery―(さもなくば)―Thank Heaven, I am quite well now.
お蔭さまで借金も片づきました
I must thank you for freeing me from debts―You have freed me from my debts―You have helped me out of my pecuniary difficulties.
お蔭で疑いが氷解しました
I must thank you for making the matter clear―You have made the matter clear to me.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: お蔭で忰も一人前になりました
You have made a man of my boy.
お蔭で天下晴れての女房になりました
You have made an honest woman of me.
お蔭で娘がキズ物になりました
You have ruined my daughter.
お蔭で好い地位を得ました
You have secured me a good position.
お蔭で助かりました
You have saved me.

content:
おかざり〔お飾り〕
〈名〉
1. A decoration

content.content: 新年のお飾り
the New Year's decorations

content: 2. (=実権の無い長官など)a figurehead

content.content: うちの長官はお飾りだ
Our chief is a mere figurehead.

おがさわらじま〔小笠原島〕
〈固名〉The Bonin islands

content:
おがさわらりゅう〔小笠原流〕
〈名〉The Ogasawara school of etiquette

content.content: あの家では万事が小笠原流だ
In that family, everything is conducted on the Ogasawara system.

content:
おかしい〔可笑しい〕
〈主観的自動詞〉(=笑いたくなる)to be amused (at or by or with something); to be tickled (at or by something)

content.content: 彼があまり威張るからおかしい
I am amused at his pompousness.
彼が高言を吐くのがおかしい(片腹痛い)
I am tickled at his talking in such a lofty strain.
あれで学者で通ってるからおかしい
I am tickled by his passing for a scholar.
あまりおかしくて腹を抱えて笑った
I was so amused that I held my sides with laughter.
あまりおかしくて笑わずにいられなかった
I was so tickled that I could not but laugh―I was too tickled not to laugh.
おかしくてたまらなかった
I could not keep my gravity―I had much ado to keep my countenance.
彼が大臣になったとさ、まぁ考えてもご覧、おかしいじゃないか
Just think of his being a cabinet minister!―The idea of his being a minister!

content:
〈客観的形容詞〉
1. (=笑うべき)laughable; ridiculous; ludicrous; funny; comical; droll; fantastic; grotesque; incongruous; absurd; silly

content.content: 彼はおかしなことをする
He does laughable things―His conduct is ridiculous.
おかしなことを言う
He says silly things―make ludicrous remarks.
おかしな身なりをしている
He is fantastically dressed.
古代の織物はおかしな模様が付いている
Antique fabrics have grotesque design on them.
子どもが大人じみたことを言うとおかしい
An old head on young shoulders is incongruous.
彼はおかしな言い訳をする
He makes absurd excuses.
あの人が洋服を着るとおかしい
He looks funny in foreign clothes.
背の低い人が高帽をかぶるとおかしい
It is comical to see a short man in a tall hat.
彼はおかしいほどていねいだ
He is polite to a ridiculous extent.
何がおかしいか
What is there laughable about it?―Where does the joke come in?
何もおかしいことは無い
There is nothing to laugh at.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人はおかしな英語を使う
He speaks English very much after a fashion.
おかしな顔をする
to make faces―make up a face
おかしな顔をして人をからかう
to make faces at one
彼はおかしな顔をして僕をからかった
He made faces at me.
この鏡で見ると顔がおかしく見える
This mirror distorts your features.

content: 2. (=面白可笑しい)amusing; funny

content.content: あの人はおかしい話をする
He tells amusing stories.
僕は昨日おかしな思いをした
I had an amusing experience yesterday.
あの人はおかしなことを言って人を笑わせる
He amuses us by saying funny things.
(君達は笑っているが)だまされるのが何がおかしいか僕にわからぬ
I do not see the fun of being cheated.

content: 3. (=奇怪な)strange; odd

content.content: 彼が落第したのはおかしい
It is strange that he should have failed.
彼はあれほど固く約束をしておいて来ないのはおかしい
It is strange that he should not have come after all his solemn promises.
返事が来ないのがちとおかしい
It is rather odd that no answer should have come.
ちょいと見るとおかしい
It looks strange at first sight.
おかしく聞こえる
to sound strange
こう言うとおかしいようだがやはり事実だ
Strange as it may sound, it is true for all that.
おかしいことにはこの動物は声が無い
Strange to say, this animal has no voice.

content: 4. (=怪しい)suspicious; ugly

content.content: あの人は女将とおかしいぜ
He has suspicious relations with the landlady.
彼はその金を取ったとするとおかしい
If he really took the money, his conduct looks ugly.

content: 5. (=不穏当)improper; unbecoming

content.content: 着流しじゃおかしい
It would be improper to go in undress.
僕がそんな相談を持ち出したらおかしくあるまいか
Would it be quite proper for me to make such a proposal?
女があぐらかいちゃおかしい
It is unbecoming in a girl to sit tailor-fashion.
私の口からはおかしいがこの子は天才です
The boy is a genius, though I say it who should not.
弁解するとかえっておかしい
Excuses will make the matter worse.

content:
おかしがる〔可笑しがる〕
〈自動〉To be amused (at or by or with something); to be tickled (at or by something)

content.content: 彼があまり威張るから人がおかしがっている
People are amused at his pompousness.
彼があまり高言を吐くから皆おかしがっている
Everybody is tickled at his talking in such a lofty strain.

content:
おかしさ〔可笑しさ〕
〈名〉
1. ［主観的］An impulse to laugh; amusement

content.content: おかしさをこらえる
to restrain one's amusement―keep one's gravity―keep one's countenance
おかしさがこらえきれなかった
I could not keep my gravity―I had much ado to keep my countenance.

content: 2. ［客観的］Laughableness; ridiculousness; ludicrousness; incongruity; absurdity

content.content: そのおかしさといったら無い
Nothing can be more ridiculous.

content:
おかす〔侵す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=侵入する)to invade (a country); to make an inroad upon (a country); to raid, make a raid upon (a territory); to encroach upon (one's territory); to gain upon (the land, etc.)

content.content: 国土を侵す
to invade a country―make an inroad upon a country
領土を侵す(蚕食する)
to encroach on one's territory
国境を侵す
to raid the frontier―make a raid on the frontier
沿岸を侵す
to make a raid on the coast―descend on the coast―come down upon the coast
ウラジオストック隊が日本の沿岸を侵した
The Vladivostok squadron made a raid on the coast of Japan.
人の領分を侵しては困る
You are encroaching on my province.
海が陸を侵している
The sea gains upon the land.
水は市街地を侵してきた
The water was gaining upon the streets.

content: 2. (=侵害する)to infringe on, intrench on, trespass on, trample upon (one's rights); to encroach on (one's functions); to intrude on (one's privacy); to violate (the sanctity, etc.)

content.content: 職権を侵す
to encroach on one's functions
人の職権を侵しては困る
You must not encroach on others' functions.
権利を侵す
to infringe on one's rights―intrench on one's rights―trespass on one's rights
版権を侵す
to infringe on copyright
専買権を侵す
to infringe on a patent
人権を侵す
to trample upon human rights
人の縄張を侵す
to trespass on one's sphere of influence―encroach on one's domains
ドイツは日本の勢力範囲を侵した
Germany trespassed on Japan's sphere of influence.
人の密室を侵す
to intrude upon one's privacy
神聖を侵す
to violate the sanctity
家庭の神聖の侵す
to violate the sanctity of the home
天皇は神聖にして侵すべからず
The Emperor is sacred and inviolable.

content:
おかす〔犯す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=罪を犯す)to commit (a crime or a sin); to perpetrate (a crime); to be guilty of (a crime); to sin (against morality, etc.)

content.content: 罪を犯す
to commit a crime―(は法律上の罪、宗教道徳の罪なら)―commit a sin―(大罪なら)―perpetrate a crime
僕は知らずして大罪を犯したのであった
I had committed a great crime―perpetrated a heinous crime―without knowing it.
我れは天に対して罪を犯せり
I have sinned against Heaven.
男色は自然に対して罪を犯すものである
Sodomy is a sin against nature.
その罪を犯した覚えがあるか
Are you guilty of the crime?
罪を犯した覚えが無い
I am innocent of the crime.
彼は痴情に駆られて大罪を犯した
Passion impelled him to crime.
罰が怖いから罪を犯さない者が多い
The fear of punishment deters many people from crime.
窃盗罪を犯す
to commit theft
謀殺罪を犯す
to commit murder
姦通罪を犯す
to commit adultery

content: 2. (=法律、規則を犯す)to break, infringe, violate, transgress, contravene, offend against, trespass against (the law); to break, violate, offend against (rules or regulations)

content.content: 僕は知らずして法を犯したのであった
I had broken the law―infringed the law―violated the law―offended against the law―without knowing it.
この規則を犯す者は十円の科料に処せらるべし
The violation of this rule is punishable with a fine of ten yen.
禁を犯す
to do what is prohibited―violate the ban―violate the interdict
この禁を犯す者は死刑に処せらる
It is prohibited on penalty of death.
日本では亜片の禁を犯す者は死刑
In Japan, opium-smoking is prohibited under penalty of death.

content: 3. (=女を犯す)to seduce, debauch, dishonour, defile, rape, ravish, violate, outrage, force (a woman)

content.content: 処女を犯す
to deflower a virgin―ruin a maiden

content: 4. (=無視する)to defy; to set (authority) at naught; to set (one's advice or warning) at defiance

content.content: 上を犯す
to defy authority―set authority at naught
彼はどこか犯すべからざる威厳がある
There is about him a dignity which keeps people at a distance.
彼は非常に謙遜だがどこか犯し難いところがある
He is exceedingly modest, but there is something about him which forbids familiarity.

content:
おかす〔冒す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=危険などを冒す)to brave, face, defy, dare, venture (a danger); to run (a risk or a hazard)

content.content: 危険を冒す
to brave a danger―face a danger―defy a danger―dare a danger―tempt Providence―fly in the face of Providence―venture―(損をする危険なら)―run a risk―run a hazard
損をするような危険を冒すのはいやだ
I don't like to run risks.
危険などを冒して何をする
to do anything in spite of―in defiance of―in the face of―in the teeth of―danger
危険を冒して進んだ
We advanced in defiance of danger.
雨を冒して行った
I went in spite of the rain―I want notwithstanding the rain―The rain did not prevent my going.
彼は病苦を冒して試験に臨んだ
He sat for the examination in spite of his illness―His illness did not prevent his taking the examination.
暴風雨を冒して出港した
We put to sea in the teeth of a storm―amidst the storm.
猛烈なる砲火を冒して突進した
We made a dash in the face of a hot fire.
彼は万難を冒して目的を遂行した
He accomplished his purpose in the face of difficulties―Nothing could hinder him from accomplishing his purpose.
烈しい反対を冒して改革を断行した
The reform was effected in the teeth of fierce opposition.
万死を冒して試みる決心だ
I am determined to try it at all risks―at the risk of my life.

content: 2. (=病が人を冒す)to attack; to affect; to infect; to visit

content.content: 病魔に冒される
to be attacked with a disease―stricken with a disease―seized with an illness
肋膜炎に冒された
I was attacked with pleurisy―stricken with pleurisy.
肺が冒されている
The lungs are affected.
流行病が市の大部分を冒している
The epidemic has infected the greater part of the city.
市の大部分が腸チフスに冒されている
The greater part of the city is infected with typhoid fever.
支那の労働者は過激思想に冒されている
The labouring classes of China are infected with Bolshevism.
その国へ行けば不幸に陥ることも無く病に冒さるることも無し
If you go there, no calamity shall fall on you, no evil visit you.
死病に冒された
He was visited with a fatal disease.

content: 3. (=神聖を穢す)to desecrate (a temple); to profane (the name of God); to impair (one's dignity)

content.content: 安息日を冒す
to break the Sabbath
皇室の尊厳を冒す
to impair the dignity of the Throne

content: 4. (=姓を取る)to assume (a name)

content.content: 還俗して橘の姓を冒した
He returned to secular life, and assumed the surname of Tachibana.

content:
おかず〔お数〕
〈名〉Subsidiary articles of diet; fish or vegetables (eaten along with rice)

content.content: 果物はおかずにはならぬ
Fruit won't do to eat along with rice.

おかっぴき〔岡引〕
〈名〉(The former name for) a detective's man, a thief-taker

content:
おかどちがい〔お門違い〕
〈名〉Going to the wrong house

content.content: そりゃお門違いだ
You have come to the wrong shop―caught the wrong sow by the ear.
僕を責めるのはちとお門違いでしょう
You put the saddle on the wrong horse.

content:
おかぶ〔お株〕
〈名〉
1. (=占有の地位)an established position; an established reputation; an established character

content.content: お株になる
to establish a reputation―establish a character
正直というお株になる
to establish a character for honesty
彼は正直というお株になっている
He has a character for honesty.
好いお株になっている
He has a good established reputation.
彼は只居で月に五百円入るといううまいお株だ
He has a nice sinecure position that brings him in 500 yen a month.
彼はお株が上がった
He has lost his reputation―lost his character.

content: 2. (=得手)one's forte

content.content: 即吟はあの人のお株だ
Improvisation is his forte.
お株を人に取られる
to be outdone by another

おかぼ〔陸穂〕
〈名〉The land rice-plant

content:
おかぼれ〔岡惚れ〕
〈名〉Worshipping at a distance:(=する) to worship (one) at a distance

content.content: 彼女はあの人に岡惚れしている
She worships him at a distance.
岡惚れ三年色の中
Three years of unrequited love will entitle one to be loved.

content:
おかま〔お釜〕
〈名〉Sodomy; buggery

content.content: お釜掘る
to practise sodomy

おかみ〔お上〕
〈名〉
1. (=主上)His Majesty; the Emperor
2. (=政府)the government; the authorities
3. (=主人)one's master; one's lord

おかみ〔女将〕
〈名〉The mistress (of a restaurant); the hostess (of a hotel); the landlady (of a lodging-house, etc.)

おがみ〔男神〕
〈名〉A male deity:(a goddess に対し) a god

content:
おがみあげる〔拝み上げる〕
〈他動〉To place (one) among the gods; to relegate (one to some inactive sphere)

content.content: 彼は枢密院へ拝み上げられた
He was placed among the gods of the Privy Council―relegated to the Privy Council―kicked upstairs into the Privy Council.

content:
おがみうち〔拝み打ち〕
〈名〉A cut in the forehead

content.content: 拝み打ちにする
to give one a cut in the forehead

おかみさん〔お上さん〕
〈名〉(A commoner's) wife; missis; missus

おがみたおし〔拝み倒し〕
〈名〉Compelling consent by repeated entreaties

content:
おがみたおす〔拝み倒す〕
〈他動〉To compel (one) to consent by repeated entreaties

content.content: とうとう拝み倒された
I was entreated into consenting―I could not resist his entreaties.

content:
おがむ〔拝む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=礼拝する)to worship, adore, pray to (God)

content.content: 手を合わして拝む
to pray with folded hands―fold one's hands in prayer
拝みます頼みます
On my knees I implore.
彼はその人に拝んで頼んだ
He implored the man on his knees to do so.

content: 2. (=拝見する)(honorific for) to look at, see (anything)

content.content: 陛下のお通りを拝む
to see the Emperor pass
盲人はありがたい日光が拝まれぬ
The blind are debarred from enjoying the blessed light of heaven.
こんな品はめったに拝まれたものじゃない
Such articles are rarely to be met with.
ちょっと拝めた顔だ
She has a face worth looking at.

おかめ〔お亀〕
〈名〉
1. (=お多福)a fat and well-liking woman
2. (=醜婦)a homely woman

content:
おかめ〔岡目〕
〈名〉A looker-on; an outsider

content.content: 岡目八目
“Lookers-on see more than the players”―“Lookers-on see the most of the game”―“The outsider sees the best of the game.”
岡目に見えぬ苦労がある
“None but the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.”

おかもち〔岡持〕
〈名〉A covered tub with a handle (for sending home ordered dishes)

content:
おかやき〔岡焼き〕
〈名〉An outsider's jealousy:(=する) to be jealous (of one's success, etc.)

content.content: 岡焼連は気をもんでいる
The interested outsiders are worrying themselves.

content:
おかゆ〔岡湯〕
〈名〉Hot water used outside a bath-tub

content.content: 岡湯を使う
to rinse oneself with hot water (outside the bath)

おがら〔苧殻〕
〈名〉The stalk of flax or hemp (separated from the fibre); boon

おかわ〔虎子〕
〈名〉A chamber-tub (for children)

おがわ〔小川〕
〈名〉A rivulet; a brook; a streamlet

content:
おかわり〔お代り〕
〈名〉A second help; another helping:(=する) to ask for a second help

content.content: お代わりをしてもよいものか
Is it proper to ask for a second help?
お代わりを上げましょうか
Will you have another helping?
幾度もお代わりして食った
He asked for it again and again.
酒のお代わり
Bring another bottle!

content:
おかん〔悪寒〕
〈名〉A chill; a cold fit; rigor

content.content: 悪寒を感ずる
to feel a chill―have a chill come over one

content:
おき〔沖〕
〈名〉The offing; the horizon; the open sea:(=に) in the offing; off-shore; off the coast:(=で) in the offing; at sea

content.content: 沖の船
ships in the offing
沖に船が見える
I see a ship in the offing.
沖に黒船が現れた
A foreign ship appeared in the offing.
沖へ出る(船を沖へ出す)
to gain an offing―stand out to sea
(航路を転じて)沖へ出る
to bear out to sea
沖へ漕ぎ出す
to pull out to sea
舟が沖へ流された
The boat was driven out to sea―The boat drifted out to sea.
潮のために舟が沖へ流された
The tide swept the boat out to sea.
船が(陸に接近せずに)沖に居る
A ship keeps an offing―lies off (the coast).
航路を沖に取る
to bear off the coast
船は紀州沖で難破した
The ship was wrecked off the coast of Kii.
初瀬艦は旅順沖で沈没した
The Hatsuse went down off Port Arthur.
暗礁は五マイル沖にある
The rocks are five miles off-shore.
沖で艪櫂が手に付かぬ
I can not work the ship at sea.
沖の暗いのに白帆が見える
A white sail is relieved against the dark horizon.
沖の暗いのに
Against the offing dark
白帆が見える
A white sail is in sight;
あれは紀の国
It is the orange-bark
蜜柑船
From Kii's sunny bight.

content:
おき〔置き〕
〈前置詞相当〉At intervals of (so many feet or minutes)

content.content: 電車は五分おきに立つ
The cars start at intervals of five minutes―every five minutes.
並木は二間おきに植わっている
The trees stand at intervals of 12 feet―12 feet apart (from each other).
三百フィートおきに柱を立てる
The poles are set up at intervals of 300 feet―300 feet apart.
一日おきに体操がある
We have gymnastics every other day―every second day.
二日おきに湯に入る
I take a bath every third day.
一行おきに書け
Write on every other line―on alternate lines.
英国では七年おき(七年ごとに)畑を休ませる
In England, land is allowed to lie fallow every seven years―every eighth year.

おき〔燠〕
〈名〉A live coal; embers

おぎ〔荻〕
〈名〉A kind of reed

content:
おきあい〔沖合〕
〈名〉The offing

content.content: 沖合漁業
off-shore fisheries

おきあかす〔起き明かす〕
〈自動〉To sit up all night

おきあがりこぼうし〔起上り小法師〕
〈名〉A toy figure so contrived as to recover its upright position when thrown down; a tumbler

content:
おきあがる〔起き上がる〕
〈自動〉To get up; to rise

content.content: ころんで起き上がった
I tumbled down and picked myself up―regained my feet―recovered my legs.
床の上に起き上がる
to sit up in bed―raise oneself in bed

おきかえる〔置き換える〕
〈他動〉To change the position of (a thing); to interchange (two things); to transpose (two or more things); to rearrange (many things)

content:
おきころび〔起き転び〕
〈名〉Vicissitudes (of fortune); ups and downs (of life)

content.content: 起き転びは世の常
Life is liable to vicissitudes.

content:
おきざり〔置き去り〕
〈名〉Desertion:(=する) to desert (one's wife); to leave (a person) behind; to leave (one) in the lurch

content.content: 彼は女房を置き去りにして行ってしまった
He has deserted his wife.
妻子を置き去りにして諸国を歩いた
He travelled all over the country, leaving his wife and family behind.
僕一人置き去りにして皆行ってしまった
They are gone, leaving me behind―leaving me to myself.
彼は僕を窮地に置き去りにした
He left me in the lurch.
こんな場合に置き去りはご免だよ
I hope you will not leave me in the lurch.
置き去りを喰う
to be left behind―left in the lurch
昔悪い事をした水夫を海中の孤島に置き去りにする習慣があった
It was formerly the custom to maroon a culprit on a desert island.

おきちがえる〔置き違える〕
〈他動〉To misplace; to mislay

content:
おきて〔掟〕
〈名〉A law; a statute; a rule; a regulation

content.content: 掟を作る
to make a law―make a rule
掟を設ける、掟を定める
to establish a law―lay down a law
掟に従う
to obey the law
掟を守る
to observe the law―keep the rule
掟に背く、掟を破る
to break the law―infringe the law―violate the law―offend against the law

content:
おきてがみ〔置手紙〕
〈名〉A note left for one:(=する) to leave a note for one

content.content: 不在だったから置き手紙をして来た
As he was not at home, I left a note for him.

おきどけい〔置時計〕
〈名〉A table-clock

content:
おきどころ〔置所〕
〈名〉A place for anything

content.content: 五尺のからだ置き所無し
The word has no place for me.
身の置き所が無い
I don't know what to do with myself.

content:
おきな〔翁〕
〈名〉An old man

content.content: 三歳の翁あり百歳の童子あり
“A man may be old at seventeen, and young at seventy.”

content:
おぎない〔補い〕
〈名〉
1. Compensation, reparation (for a loss); a remedy (for a defect); complement; supplement

content.content: 不足の補い
compensation for a deficiency
あの人が来れば補いがつく
He will supply the deficiency.
損の補い
compensation for a loss―reparation for a loss
ここで儲ければ前に損をした補いがつく
This gain will compensate for the former loss―make up for the former loss―make good the former loss.
病気で休んだ補いをしなけりゃならぬ
I must make up for lost time.
欠点の補い
a remedy for a defect
細君が内職をして生計の補いをしている
His wife does home-work to eke out the income―piece out the income―help out the income―supplement the income.

content: 2. (=健康の回復)recovery, recuperation (of health)

content.content: 滋養物を取って身体の補いをつけよう
I shall recuperate myself by eating nourishing food.

content:
おぎなう〔補う〕
〈他動〉To supply, make good, make up for (the deficiency); to make up (a deficit); to compensate for, make up for, make good, repair (a loss); to atone for, make amends for (one's idleness); to remedy (a defect); to fill up, stop (a gap); to offset (a fault); to set off (a merit against a fault); to eke out, help out, piece out (one's income); to complement, supplement (a statement, etc.)

content.content: 不足を補う
to supply the deficiency―make good the deficiency―make up for the deficiency―fill up the gap―stop the gap
不足額(欠損)を補おう
I will make up the deficit.
欠員を補う
to fill up a vacancy―(軍隊なら)―replenish the ranks―recruit the army
欠乏を補う
to supply the need―make up for a want
僕は学力が足らないから勉強をもって補うのだ
I make up by diligence for my want of ability.
彼は学力の足らんところを勉強をもって補っている
What he lacks in ability he makes up in diligence.
損失を補う
to compensate for a loss―make up for a loss―make good a loss―repair a loss
ここで儲ければ前の損が補える
This gain will make up for the former loss―make good the former loss.
病気で後れた処を補わなければならぬ
I must make up for lost time.
欠点を補う
to remedy a defect―repair a fault
人の長を取って己が短を補え
Utilize others' merits to remedy your own defects.
長所をもって短所を補う
to set off a merit against a fault
彼は短所を補うだけの長所がある
He has enough merits to set off against his faults.
短所を補うだけの長所が無い
He has no merits to set off against his faults.
長所相補う
His merits and faults offset each other.
細君が内職をして生計を補っている
His wife does home-work to eke out―piece out―help out―supplement―the income.

content:
おきなおる〔起き直る〕
〈自動〉To sit up (in bed)

content.content: 傾いた船が起き直る
A ship rights herself.

content:
おきにいり〔お気に入り〕
〈名〉A favourite:(=の) favourite; pet and darling

content.content: 彼は主人のお気に入りだ
He is a favourite with his master―in high favour with his master.
お母さんのお気に入りの子だ
He is her favourite child―her pet and darling child.

content:
おきにいる〔お気に入る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: きにいる〔気に入る〕

content:
おきば〔置場〕
〈名〉A place for anything; a depository; a receptacle

content.content: 本の置場が無い
There is no place for the books.
馬車置場
a carriage-house
材木置場
a timber-yard
自動車置場
a garage

content:
おきばなし〔置き放し〕
〈名〉Leaving (anything)

content.content: 手紙は返事は要らぬ(置き放しでよい)
You need not wait for an answer.

content:
おきふし〔起き臥し〕
〈名〉Getting up and lying down

content.content: 彼は起きふしも独りでできない
He is a helpless cripple.

content:
おきまり〔お極まり、お決まり〕
〈形〉Usual; customary; conventional; eternal; favourite

content.content: ああ言うのが先生のおきまりだ
That is his favourite expression.
おきまりのお惣菜かね
The eternal potatoes!
先生あのしゃれを担ぎ込むのがおきまりだ
He always drags in that joke.

content:
おきまり〔お極まり、お決まり〕
〈形〉Usual; customary; conventional; eternal; favourite

content.content: ああ言うのが先生のおきまりだ
That is his favourite expression.
おきまりのお惣菜かね
The eternal potatoes!
先生あのしゃれを担ぎ込むのがおきまりだ
He always drags in that joke.

content:
おきみやげ〔置土産〕
〈名〉A present made prior to one's departure; a parting present

content.content: 置土産はご免だよ
You must not leave troubles behind you.

content:
おきもの〔置物〕
〈名〉
1. (=飾物)an ornament (for the alcove or the mantel); a centre-piece (for the table)
2. (=実権の無い長官など)a figurehead

content.content: うちの社長は置物同然だ
Our president is a mere figurehead.

content:
オギャー
〈擬音詞〉Mewl

content.content: 赤児がオギャーと泣く
A baby mewls.
人間はオギャーと泣いて生まれる
Man is born crying.

おきゃーがれ
〈間投詞〉Get along with you!

content:
おきゃく〔お客〕
〈名〉
1. A guest
2. A party

content.content: お客をする
to give a party

おきゃん
〈名〉A pert girl; a minx

content:
おきょう〔お経〕
〈名〉The sutras; the Buddhist scriptures

content.content: お経を読む
to read the sutras
彼が本を読むのはお経を読むようだ
He reads in a singsong style.

おきりょう〔沖漁〕
〈名〉Off-shore fishing

content:
おきる〔起きる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=起床する)to get up; to rise; to turn out; to come down(寝室は通例二階にあるがゆえにかく言う); to stir

content.content: もう起きる時間だ
It is time to get up.
まだ起きるには早い
It is too early to get up.
彼はもう起きた
He is already up―He has come down already.
まだ起きない
He is not yet up―He has not come down yet.
君は何時に起きるか
What time do you get up?
早く起きるか
Do you rise early?―Are you an early riser?
明朝は早く起きなさい
Be up betimes tomorrow morning.
朝早く起きて天気模様を見た
I was up betimes to mark the signs of weather.
君は今朝遅く起きたね
You rose late this morning.
僕は今朝起きた時は誰も起きていなかった
When I got up this morning, no one was stirring yet―the house was not yet astir.
病人はもう起きて歩けるようになった
He can get about now.
この薬は朝起きるとすぐお飲みなさい
Take the medicine immediately on rising―the first thing in the morning.
寝ずに起きている
to sit up―stay up―stop up
僕は夜遅くまで起きている
I sit up till late.
昨夜も十二時過ぎまで起きていた
I sat up till past twelve last night.
ひと晩起きていることがある
I sit up all night sometimes.
忙がしくて遅くまで起きていた
Business kept me up till late.
家族はまだ起きている
The family are still up.
家族はいつもより遅くまで起きている
The family are staying up beyond the usual hour.
人の帰りを起きて待つ
to sit up for one
今晩は帰りが遅いから起きて待つことはない
I shall be late this evening, so you need not sit up for me.
酒屋はまだ起きているかしら
I wonder if the wine-shop is still open.

content: 3. (=目を覚ます)to awake; to wake up

content.content: そんな大きな声を出すと子どもが起きる
You will awaken the child.
君は起こされずに独りで起きるか
Do you awake of yourself?
今朝お前は起こされずに起きたね
You did not wait to be called this morning.
昨夜はひと晩床の中に起きておった
I lay awake in bed all last night.

content: 4. (=起き上がる)to get up; to rise:(転んで起き上がる)to pick oneself up; to regain one's feet; to recover one's legs

content.content: 彼はバッタリ倒れたきり起きない
He suddenly fell down, never to rise again.
彼は氷の上に転んで起きられなかった
He fell on the ice, and could not regain his feet.
火が起きる
Fire kindles―Fire is kindled.

content:
おきわすれる〔置き忘れる〕
〈他動〉To mislay; to leave; to forget

content.content: その手紙をどこかへ置き忘れた
I have mislaid the letter.
本を学校へ置き忘れて来た
I have left my book at the school.
誰か傘を置き忘れて行ったな
Somebody has forgotten his (or her) umbrella.

content:
おく〔奥〕
〈名〉The interior; the inner part; the inmost part; the heart (of a country); the recesses (of a mountain); the depths (of a forest); the mysteries (of an art):(=の) inner; interior; ulterior

content.content: 山の奥に
in the recesses of the mountains
山の奥に分け入る
to seek the recesses of the mountains
林の奥に
in the depths of the forest
斯道の奥を極める
to be initiated into the mysteries of the art
心の奥まで見抜いている
I have seen through his heart―penetrated into his motive.
この奥に貸家あり
House to let up this court.
(店の)奥
the back parlour―the family-room―the family
奥に用がある
I have business with the master's family.
奥の間
an inner room
一番奥の間
the inmost room
人を奥へ通す
to show one into the inner apartment
奥の院
the inner shrine―the holy of holies
奥の手
one's last resort―one's best cards―a card up one's sleeve
何か奥の目的がありそうだ
He must have some ulterior object―some end in view―an axe to grind.

content:
おく〔億〕
〈名〉A hundred millions

content.content: 十億
a thousand millions―a milliard―(米国にては)―a billion

content:
おく〔措く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=除く)to except; to set apart; to lay aside

content.content: これを措いて
except this―but this―(さておいての意味なら)―setting apart―apart from...
これを措いてほかに道が無い
There is no way except this―There is no way but this―There is no other way―There is no alternative.
彼の無分別はしばらく措いて運も悪かった
Setting apart his imprudence,―Apart from his imprudence,―he has also been unfortunate.
その罪はしばらく措いてずいぶんばかなことをしたものだ
Apart from the criminality of the action, what a foolish thing he has done!
何を措いても
laying aside everything―before everything―above all things
学生は何を措いても学問を大事にしなけりゃならぬ
A student should, above all, attend to his studies.
何を措いても英語と数学をやらなくてはならぬ
You must learn, before everything, English and mathematics.

content: 2. (=止める)to leave off; to give up; to desist

content.content: 措きなさい
Don't!
このことばかりは措かせられい
You had better desist from the attempt.
嘆賞措くあたわず
I am filled with admiration―lost in admiration.
喜悦措くあたわず
I am transported with joy―in an agony of joy.
恐懼措くあたわず
I am filled with awe―overawed.
せずに措く
to leave anything undone
捜さずに措かない
I will not leave it unsearched for―I will be sure to search for it.

content:
おく〔置く〕
〈他動〉
1. (物をどこに置く)to place; to put:(立てて置く)to set:(横に置く)to lay:(一定の場所に入れて置く)to deposit

content.content: 本をどこへ置いたか
Where have you placed the book?
ペンをインキ入れのわきに置いた
I have put the pen by the inkstand.
ランプを卓子の上に置け
Set the lamp on the table!
本を机の上を置いた
I have put the book on the table―laid the book on the table.
本を棚の上に置いた
I have set the book on the shelf.
貨物を税関に置く
to deposit the goods at the custom-house
皆置くべき処に置いてある
Everything is in its place.
土台を置く
to lay the foundation
彼はこの時大成の基礎を置いた
He then laid the foundation of his future greatness.

content: 2. (=下に置く)to put down; to set down; to lay down

content.content: 値を聞いて品物を置いた
On hearing the price, I put down the article.
かごを下に置いてその上に腰掛けた
He set down the basket, and sat down upon it.
筆を置く
to lay down one's pen―close (a chapter or a letter)
下にも置かないもてなしぶり
They were assiduous in their attentions towards their guest.

content: 3. (=しまって置く)to keep

content.content: 君は貴重品をどこへ置くか
Where do you keep your valuables?
この箱に何を入れて置くか
What do you keep in this box?
魚を涼しい処に置け
Keep the fish in a cool place!
この魚は明日まで置いても大丈夫か
Can I keep this fish overnight?

content: 4. (=残して置く)to leave

content.content: 学校へ本を置いて来た
I have left my book at the school.
この手紙を役所へ置いて来い
Leave this letter at the office!
(八百屋に向って)玉菜と玉葱を置いて行っておくれ
Leave some cabbages and onions.
入らずに名刺を置いて来た
I did not enter, but left a card on him.
その方はお手紙を置いて行かれました
He has left a note for you.
時計をこんな処へ置くと盗まれるよ
You will have you watch stolen if you leave it about.

content: 5. (=何をどうしておく)to have, keep, leave (anything in a certain state or condition)

content.content: お前を遊ばしておくことはできぬ
I can not have you idle.
仕事が無いので職人を遊ばしておく
We are in want of work, and have the men lying idle.
車を待たしておいた
I have my ricksha waiting for me.
その人を待たしておけ
Let him wait!―Bid him wait!―Tell him to wait!
天気の好い時は窓を明けておけ
Keep the window open in fine weather.
戸を明けておいた
(わざとなら)I have kept the door open―(忘れてなら)―left the door open.
彼を(寝かさないで)起こしておけ
Keep him awake!
この魚を生かしておけ
Keep the fish alive!
風呂を(冷めないように)熱くしておけ
Keep the bath hot!
事を秘しておけ
Keep the matter a secret!
名を学籍に置く
to keep one's name on the books
あの店では好い品を置く
They keep good articles in stock.
事をせずにおく
to leave anything undone
それは言わずにおく方が好い(言わぬが花)
Better leave it unsaid!
場所をきめずにおいた
We have left the place undecided.
そのままにしておけ
Leave it as it is!
古い家をそのままにしておいた
We have left the old house standing.
やはり野に置け蓮花草
Leave her where she is!
(彼にかまわずに)打遣っておけ
Let him be!―Let him alone!―Leave him alone!―Leave him in peace!―Leave him unmolested!―Do not molest him!
茶が出るまで置いておく
Let the tea stand while it steeps.

content: 6. (=どうしておく)to get (something done)

content.content: 今日中に仕事をしておこう
I will get my work done in the course of the day.
今晩作文を書いておこう
I will get my composition written this evening.
試験の用意に本を読んでおこう
I must read up for the examination.
考えておく
I will think about it―I shall consider.
金を貯えておいた
I have laid up―laid by―put by―set by―some money.
時計を合わしておいた
I have set the watch.
(お買いになるなら)品物を取っておいて上げます
I will put aside the article for you.
君のために仕事を取っておいた
I have reserved a task for you.
五十円にしておく
Make it 80 yen.
どうかしておこう
I will manage it somehow.
好いようにしておく
I will set the matter right.

content: 7. (=人を置く)to keep, take (boarders or lodgers)

content.content: 下宿人を置く
to keep boarders―(始めてなら)―take in lodgers
お宅では下宿人をお置きになりますか
Do you keep boarders?
人に頼まれて二三人置きます
We keep a few to oblige some friends.
せっかくのお頼みだから置いて上げましょう
Since you are so earnest in requesting, I will take you.
僕の家に置いてやろう
I will give you a home with me.
彼は大勢食客を置く
He has many dependants.

content: 8. (=兵を置く)to post, station (troops)

content.content: 線路に兵を置く
to station troops along the railway line
番兵置く、哨兵を置く
to post a sentry
あの家に張番を置こう
We shall post a picket at the house.

content: 9. (=抱える)to keep (a servant or a carriage)

content.content: 女中を二人おく
We keep two servants.
彼は下女もおかずに倹約している
He does without a servant.
あの家では大勢人をおく
They keep a large establishment.
彼は車をおいているか
Does he keep a ricksha?
君は馬車くらいおいても好い身分だ
You are rich enough to keep a carriage.

content: 10. (=設ける)to establish (a school); to open (a school, etc.)

content.content: 藩を廃し県を置く
The clans were abolished, and prefectures were established in their place.
図書館を置く
to establish a library
本校には図書館が置いてある
The school is provided with a library.
簡易科を置く
to establish a shorter course
本校には簡易科が置いてある
The school is provided with a shorter course.
各県に知事を置く
A governor is set over each prefecture―Each prefecture is placed under a governor.
各省に大臣を置く
A minister is set over each department―Each department is placed under a minister.
京都に支部を置く
We open a branch in Kyoto.
(碁を打つ時)何目置く
to take so many odds
三目置かせる
to give one three odds
一目置く
to yield to one―yield the palm to one
君には一目置く
I must yield the palm to you―I acknowledge your superiority over me.
(品物を)質におく
to pawn an article
(人の話に)信をおく
to believe one―credit one's story―give credit to a story
その話は信をおくに足らぬ
The story is not to be credited―incredible.
八卦をおく
to cast a horoscope―tell fortunes
眼中におかぬ
to take no account of rank―leave the prices out of account―defy the law―set the law at defiance
その分にはしておかぬ
You shall be deservedly dealt with.

content: 〈自動〉

content.content: 露がおく
Dew falls.
霜がおく
It freezes.

おくいん〔奥印〕
〈名〉An endorsing seal; a vis?:(=する) to endorse, vis? (a document)

content:
おくがい〔屋外〕
〈名〉The open air:(=の) open-air (school); outdoor (sports):(=で) outdoors; out of doors; in the open air

content.content: 屋外遊戯
outdoor games―outdoor sports
屋外運動
open-air exercise
屋外集会
an open-air meeting

おくがき〔奥書〕
〈名〉An endorsement; a vis?:(=する) to endorse, vis? (a document)

おくがた〔奥方〕
〈名〉A nobleman's wife; the lady of the house

content:
おくぎ〔奥義〕
〈名〉Secrets (of nature); the mysteries (of an art); the heart (of things); penetralia

content.content: 物の奥義を究める
to go to the heart of things―see into the heart of things―penetrate into the inmost heart of the thing
自然の奥義を究める
to penetrate into the secrets of nature―study the secrets of nature
彼は剣道の奥義を究めている
He has been initiated into the mysteries of swordsmanship.

おくざしき〔奥座敷〕
〈名〉An inner room:(商家のは)the back parlour

content:
おくさん〔奥さん〕
〈名〉A married lady; madame:(呼びかけに用いれば)madam:(夫に向かって言えば)your lady; Mrs. xxx:(召使いが言えば)missis; missus

content.content: 山の手の方の奥さんらしかった
She seemed to be a lady from the suburbs.
奥さんもごいっしょですか
Have you brought your lady―Mrs. xxx―with you?
奥さん、おいでになりませんか
Won't you go, madam?
奥さんもごいっしょにお出かけになりました
Missis has gone out with him.

content:
おくじょう〔屋上〕
〈名〉The housetop

content.content: 屋上屋を架す
to gild refined gold―pain the lily―refine a violet
屋上庭園
a roof-garden

content:
おくする〔臆する〕
〈自動〉To be timid; to be nervous; to be abashed; to be shy (of people.)

content.content: 彼は知らない人の前へ出ると臆する
He is shy of strangers.
人前へ出ると臆して口がきけない
He is shy of talking in company.
試験官の前へ出ると臆する
He is nervous before his examiners.
いったいで臆する人だ
He is a timid man―a nervous man.
さらに臆する色無し
He is unabashed.
彼は臆する色無く訴人らの前に立った
He stood unabashed in the presence of his accusers.
彼はどんなことがあっても臆するということが無い
Nothing can abash him.

content:
おくせつ〔臆説〕
〈名〉A conjecture; a surmise; a speculation; a theory

content.content: 臆説を立てる
to hazard a conjecture
今度の事件のなりゆきについて世人は種々の臆説を立てている
People speculate on the issue of the affair.
それは先生の例の臆説だ
It is one of his theories.

content:
おくそく〔臆測〕
〈名〉Guess; conjecture; surmise; speculation:(=する) to guess; to conjecture; to surmise; to speculate (on or as to the result)

content.content: それは臆測に過ぎぬ
It is a mere conjecture.
臆測が当たった
You have guessed right.
臆測が当たらぬ
You have guessed wrong.
臆測がうんとはずれた
You have guessed wide―guessed wild―You are wide of the mark.
僕の臆測通りであった
I was right in my conjectures.
その論文を書いた人はたいがい僕の臆測通りであろうと思う
I have a shrewd guess as to who is the author of the article.
戦争の結果については世人は臆測をたくましうしている
People speculate on the issue of the war.

content:
おくそこ〔奥底〕
〈名〉
1. (=奥の奥)the inmost depths, the inmost recesses (of one's heart, etc.)

content.content: 心の奥底ではそう思っているだろう
He must think so in the inmost depths of his heart―in his heart of hearts.
心の奥底から出た言葉だ
The words come out of the depths of his heart.
奥底の知れない男だ
He is a deep one.
奥底の無い人だ
He is a frank and open-hearted man.

content: 2. (=奥の目的)ulterior aims; ulterior views

content.content: 金を取らないところを見ると奥底がありそうだ
Since he does not take the money, he must have ulterior views―some end in view.

content:
おくだん〔臆断〕
〈名〉A guess; a conjecture; a surmise:(=する) to guess; to conjecture; to surmise

content.content: 臆断を下す
to make a guess―form a conjecture
臆断が当たった
You have guessed right.
臆断が当たらぬ
You have guessed wrong―guessed wide―guessed wild.
それは臆断に過ぎない
It is a mere conjecture.
臆断の通り
I was right in my conjectures.

content:
おくちょう〔億兆〕
〈名〉The million; the multitude; the whole nation

content.content: 億兆心を一にす
The whole nation acts with one accord.
億兆心を一にして立つ
The whole nation rose as one man.

おくつき〔奥津城〕
〈名〉A grave; a tomb

おくづけ〔奥付〕
〈名〉The colophon (of a book)

おくづとめ〔奥勤め〕
〈名〉The service of a lady's maid:(=する) to serve as lady's maid

おくて〔晩稲〕
〈名〉The late rice-plant; a late crop

content:
おくない〔屋内〕
〈名〉The interior of a house:(=の) indoor:(=で) indoors; within doors

content.content: 屋内遊戯
indoor games―indoor sports

おくにわ〔奥庭〕
〈名〉An inner garden; a back garden
